@roblox/globaltype/DataModel.IsLoaded/re.documentation: Whether the client has finished loading the game for the first time.

@roblox/globaltype/DataModel.IsLoaded.documentation: Returns true if the client has finished loading the game for the first time.
@roblox/globaltype/DataModel.IsLoaded.code_sample:
local Players = game:GetService("Players")
local ReplicatedFirst = game:GetService("ReplicatedFirst")

local player = Players.LocalPlayer
local playerGui = player:WaitForChild("PlayerGui")

-- Create a basic loading screen
local screenGui = Instance.new("ScreenGui")
screenGui.IgnoreGuiInset = true

local textLabel = Instance.new("TextLabel")
textLabel.Size = UDim2.new(1, 0, 1, 0)
textLabel.BackgroundColor3 = Color3.fromRGB(0, 20, 40)
textLabel.Font = Enum.Font.GothamMedium
textLabel.TextColor3 = Color3.new(0.8, 0.8, 0.8)
textLabel.Text = "Loading"
textLabel.TextSize = 28
textLabel.Parent = screenGui

-- Parent entire screen GUI to player GUI
screenGui.Parent = playerGui

-- Remove the default loading screen
ReplicatedFirst:RemoveDefaultLoadingScreen()

--wait(3)  -- Optionally force screen to appear for a minimum number of seconds
if not game:IsLoaded() then
	game.Loaded:Wait()
end
screenGui:Destroy()

@roblox/globaltype/DataModel.SetPlaceId/.documentation: The DataModel (commonly known as game after the global variable used to access it) is the root of Roblox's parent-child hierarchy. Its direct children are services (such as the Workspace and Lighting) that act as the fundamental components of a Roblox game.
The ID to set the DataModel.PlaceId to.

@roblox/globaltype/DataModel.SetPlaceId.documentation: Sets the DataModel.PlaceId of the current game instance to the given placeId.

@roblox/globaltype/DataModel.SetUniverse.documentation: The DataModel (commonly known as game after the global variable used to access it) is the root of Roblox's parent-child hierarchy. Its direct children are services (such as the Workspace and Lighting) that act as the fundamental components of a Roblox game.
The ID to set the DataModel.GameId to.
Sets the DataModel.GameId of the current game instance to the given universeId.

@roblox/globaltype/DataModel.SavePlace/p.documentation: The DataModel (commonly known as game after the global variable used to access it) is the root of Roblox's parent-child hierarchy. Its direct children are services (such as the Workspace and Lighting) that act as the fundamental components of a Roblox game.

@roblox/globaltype/DataModel.OnClose.documentation: Invoked before the game is shut down. When this callback returns, or the timeout period is hit, the game finishes shutting down.
@roblox/globaltype/DataModel.OnClose.code_sample:
game.OnClose = function()
	print("Closing, waiting")
	task.wait(3)
	print("Done")
end

@roblox/globaltype/DataModel.AllowedGear.documentation: An object that runs connected functions upon a specific occurrence.
Connects the given function to the event and returns an RBXScriptConnection that represents it.
Yields the current thread until the signal fires and returns the arguments provided by the signal.
Fires when SetGearSettings is called with a different value for allowedGenres.

@roblox/globaltype/DataModel.GraphicsQua.documentation: An object that runs connected functions upon a specific occurrence.
Connects the given function to the event and returns an RBXScriptConnection that represents it.
Yields the current thread until the signal fires and returns the arguments provided by the signal.
Fires when the user prompts and increase or decrease in graphics quality using the hotkeys.
@roblox/globaltype/DataModel.GraphicsQua.code_sample:
game.GraphicsQualityChangeRequest:Connect(function(betterQuality)
	if betterQuality then
		print("The user has requested an increase in graphics quality!")
	else
		print("The user has requested a decrease in graphics quality!")
	end
end)

@roblox/globaltype/DataModel.ItemChanged.documentation: An object that runs connected functions upon a specific occurrence.
Connects the given function to the event and returns an RBXScriptConnection that represents it.
Yields the current thread until the signal fires and returns the arguments provided by the signal.
Fires when a property of any object in the DataModel is changed.
@roblox/globaltype/DataModel.ItemChanged.code_sample:
game.ItemChanged:Connect(function(item, property)
	print(string.format("%s.%s has changed", item.Name, property))
end)

--> Workspace.DistributedGameTime has changed

@roblox/globaltype/DataModel.Loaded.Conn.documentation: An object that runs connected functions upon a specific occurrence.
Connects the given function to the event and returns an RBXScriptConnection that represents it.

@roblox/globaltype/DataModel.Loaded.Wait.documentation: Yields the current thread until the signal fires and returns the arguments provided by the signal.

@roblox/globaltype/DataModel.Loaded.documentation: Fires on the client when the game finishes loading for the first time.

@roblox/globaltype/ImageLabel.documentation: A 2D user interface element that displays a single non-interactive image.

@roblox/globaltype/ImageLabel.Image.documentation: The image content displayed by the UI element.
@roblox/globaltype/ImageLabel.Image.code_sample:
local imageLabel = script.Parent

-- The images in this example are 64x64
imageLabel.Size = UDim2.new(0, 64, 0, 64)

local function unlock()
	imageLabel.Image = "rbxassetid://284402785" -- Unlocked padlock (64x64)
	imageLabel.ImageColor3 = Color3.new(0, 0.5, 0) -- Dark green
end

local function lock()
	imageLabel.Image = "rbxassetid://284402752" -- Locked padlock (64x64)
	imageLabel.ImageColor3 = Color3.new(0.5, 0, 0) -- Dark red
end

-- Connect events; our default state is locked
imageLabel.MouseEnter:Connect(unlock)
imageLabel.MouseLeave:Connect(lock)
lock()

@roblox/globaltype/ImageLabel.ImageColor.documentation: Determines how a rendered image will be colorized.
@roblox/globaltype/ImageLabel.ImageColor.code_sample:
local imageLabel = script.Parent

-- The images in this example are 64x64
imageLabel.Size = UDim2.new(0, 64, 0, 64)

local function unlock()
	imageLabel.Image = "rbxassetid://284402785" -- Unlocked padlock (64x64)
	imageLabel.ImageColor3 = Color3.new(0, 0.5, 0) -- Dark green
end

local function lock()
	imageLabel.Image = "rbxassetid://284402752" -- Locked padlock (64x64)
	imageLabel.ImageColor3 = Color3.new(0.5, 0, 0) -- Dark red
end

-- Connect events; our default state is locked
imageLabel.MouseEnter:Connect(unlock)
imageLabel.MouseLeave:Connect(lock)
lock()

@roblox/globaltype/ImageLabel.ImageRectO.documentation: The offset in pixels of the sub-area of an image to be displayed.

@roblox/globaltype/ImageLabel.ImageRectS.documentation: Determines the size in pixels of the sub-area of an image to be displayed.

@roblox/globaltype/ImageLabel.ImageTrans.documentation: Determines the transparency of the rendered image.

@roblox/globaltype/ImageLabel.IsLoaded.documentation: Indicates whether the Image has finished loading from the Roblox website.
@roblox/globaltype/ImageLabel.IsLoaded.code_sample:
local imageLabel = script.Parent

local startTime = workspace.DistributedGameTime

-- Wait for the image to load
while not imageLabel.IsLoaded do
	task.wait()
end

-- Measure and display how long it took to load
local deltaTime = workspace.DistributedGameTime - startTime
print(("Image loaded in %.3f seconds"):format(deltaTime))

@roblox/globaltype/ImageLabel.ResampleMo.documentation: Selects the image resampling mode for the label.

@roblox/globaltype/ImageLabel.ScaleType.documentation: Determines how an image will scale if displayed in a UI element whose size differs from the source image.

@roblox/globaltype/ImageLabel.SliceCente.documentation: Sets the slice boundaries of a 9-sliced image.

@roblox/globaltype/ImageLabel.SliceScale.documentation: Scales the 9slice edges by the specified ratio.

@roblox/globaltype/ImageLabel.TileSize.documentation: Sets the tiling size of the ImageLabel.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.documentation: Workspace houses 3D objects which are rendered to the 3D world. Objects not descending from it will not be rendered or physically interact with the world.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.AirDensity.documentation: The air density at ground level, used in the aerodynamic force model.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.AllowThirdP.documentation: Determines whether assets created by other users can be sold in the game.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.ClientAnima.documentation: Specifies the animation throttling mode for the local client.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.CurrentCame.documentation: The Camera object being used by the local player.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.Distributed.documentation: The amount of time, in seconds, that the game has been running.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.FallenParts.documentation: Determines the height at which falling BaseParts and their ancestor Models are removed from Workspace.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.FilteringEn.documentation: Determines whether changes made from the client will replicate to the server or not.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.FluidForces.documentation: Determines whether the physics engine computes aerodynamic forces on BaseParts whose EnableFluidForces property is true.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.GlobalWind.documentation: Specifies the global wind vector for animated terrain grass, dynamic clouds, and particles.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.Gravity.documentation: Determines the acceleration due to gravity applied to falling BaseParts.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.IKControlCo.documentation: Enables support for constraints for IKControls. If disabled, IKControls ignore physics constraints.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.MeshPartHea.documentation: Sets whether character Heads and Accessories should be downloaded as MeshParts.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.PhysicsStep.documentation: Sets how the solver will advance the physics simulation forward in time.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.StreamOutBe.documentation: Configures how the engine decides when to Stream content away from players.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.StreamingEn.documentation: Whether content streaming is enabled for the place.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.StreamingMi.documentation: Minimum distance that content will be streamed to players with high priority.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.StreamingTa.documentation: Maximum distance that content will be streamed to players.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.Terrain.documentation: A reference to the Terrain object parented to the Workspace.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.TouchesUseC.documentation: Determines whether parts in different groups set to not collide will ignore collisions and touch events.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.BreakJoints.documentation: Workspace houses 3D objects which are rendered to the 3D world. Objects not descending from it will not be rendered or physically interact with the world.
An array of BaseParts for whom joints are to be broken.
Goes through all BaseParts given, breaking any joints connected to these parts.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.GetNumAwake.documentation: Workspace houses 3D objects which are rendered to the 3D world. Objects not descending from it will not be rendered or physically interact with the world.
Returns the number of BaseParts that are deemed physically active, due to being recently under the influence of physics.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.GetPhysicsT.documentation: Workspace houses 3D objects which are rendered to the 3D world. Objects not descending from it will not be rendered or physically interact with the world.
The percentage of real-time that physics simulation is currently being throttled to.
Returns an integer, between 0 and 100, representing the percentage of real-time that physics simulation is currently being throttled to.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.GetRealPhys.documentation: Workspace houses 3D objects which are rendered to the 3D world. Objects not descending from it will not be rendered or physically interact with the world.
Returns the number of frames per second that physics is currently being simulated at.
Returns the number of frames per second that physics is currently being simulated at.
@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.GetRealPhys.code_sample:
local Players = game:GetService("Players")

local player = Players.LocalPlayer

while task.wait(1) do
	if workspace:GetRealPhysicsFPS() > 65 then
		player:Kick()
	end
end

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.GetServerTi.documentation: Workspace houses 3D objects which are rendered to the 3D world. Objects not descending from it will not be rendered or physically interact with the world.
The estimated epoch time on the server.
Returns the server epoch time in seconds.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.JoinToOutsi.documentation: Workspace houses 3D objects which are rendered to the 3D world. Objects not descending from it will not be rendered or physically interact with the world.
An array of BaseParts for whom joints are to be made.
The JointCreationMode to be used. Passing in Enum.JointCreationMode.All or Enum.JointCreationMode.Surface has the same behavior which equates to Join Always.
Creates joints between the specified Parts and any touching parts depending on the parts' surfaces and the specified joint creation mode.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.MakeJoints/.documentation: Workspace houses 3D objects which are rendered to the 3D world. Objects not descending from it will not be rendered or physically interact with the world.
An array of parts for whom joints are to be made.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.MakeJoints.documentation: Goes through all BaseParts given. If any part's side has a SurfaceType that can make a joint it will create a joint with any adjacent parts.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.PGSIsEnable.documentation: Workspace houses 3D objects which are rendered to the 3D world. Objects not descending from it will not be rendered or physically interact with the world.
True if the PGS solver is enabled.
Returns true if the game has the PGS Physics solver enabled.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.UnjoinFromO.documentation: Workspace houses 3D objects which are rendered to the 3D world. Objects not descending from it will not be rendered or physically interact with the world.
An array of BaseParts for whom joints are to be broken.
Breaks all joints between the specified BaseParts and other BaseParts.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.ZoomToExten.documentation: Workspace houses 3D objects which are rendered to the 3D world. Objects not descending from it will not be rendered or physically interact with the world.
Positions and zooms the Workspace.CurrentCamera to show the extent of BaseParts currently in the Workspace.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.PersistentL.documentation: An object that runs connected functions upon a specific occurrence.
Connects the given function to the event and returns an RBXScriptConnection that represents it.
Yields the current thread until the signal fires and returns the arguments provided by the signal.
Fires when persistent models have been sent to the specified player.

@roblox/globaltype/HapticService.documentation: Provides haptic feedback to some gamepad controllers.

@roblox/globaltype/HapticService.GetMoto.documentation: Provides haptic feedback to some gamepad controllers.
The current vibration value set to the specified UserInputType and VibrationMotor or nil if SetMotor has not been called prior.
Returns the current vibration value set to the specified UserInputType and VibrationMotor. This will not return anything if SetMotor has not been called prior.

@roblox/globaltype/HapticService.IsMotor.documentation: Provides haptic feedback to some gamepad controllers.
The specific UserInputType being checked for VibrationMotor support.
The specified VibrationMotor checked to see if it supports the specified UserInputType.
True if the specified motor is available to be used with the specified UserInputType, false if not.
Returns true if the specified motor is available to be used with the specified UserInputType.

@roblox/globaltype/HapticService.IsVibra.documentation: Provides haptic feedback to some gamepad controllers.
The specified UserInputType checked to see if it supports haptic feedback.
True if the specified UserInputType supports haptic feedback.
Returns true if the specified UserInputType supports haptic feedback.

@roblox/globaltype/HapticService.SetMoto.documentation: Provides haptic feedback to some gamepad controllers.
How intensely the motor should vibrate. Only uses the first value in the tuple, which should be a number.
Sets the vibration intensity of the specified UserInputType and VibrationMotor.

@roblox/globaltype/AudioDeviceOutput.documentation: Accepts audio streams to be rendered out to physical hardware devices such as speakers or headphones.
@roblox/globaltype/AudioDeviceOutput.code_sample:
local audioPlayer : AudioPlayer = Instance.new("AudioPlayer")
audioPlayer.Parent = workspace
audioPlayer.AssetId = "rbxassetid://9112854440"

local deviceOutput = Instance.new("AudioDeviceOutput")
deviceOutput.Parent = workspace

local wire = Instance.new("Wire")
wire.Parent = workspace

wire.SourceInstance = audioPlayer
wire.TargetInstance = deviceOutput

player:Play()

@roblox/globaltype/AudioDeviceOutput.Pla.documentation: A Player who is intended to hear the connected audio streams.

@roblox/globaltype/AudioDeviceOutput.Get.documentation: Accepts audio streams to be rendered out to physical hardware devices such as speakers or headphones.

@roblox/globaltype/PathfindingModifier.documentation: Modifiers used to represent space that has a higher or lower cost to be traversed when creating paths using the PathfindingService.

@roblox/globaltype/PathfindingModifier.L.documentation: The name of the navigation area inside or on top of the Part's volume.

@roblox/globaltype/PathfindingModifier.P.documentation: Determines if the parts enclosed by the modifier are traversable, even if they would normally be collided with.

@roblox/globaltype/NegateOperation.documentation: Result of a part that has been negated for use in solid modeling.

@roblox/globaltype/Plane.documentation: Constrains Attachment0 and Attachment1 such that both points lie in an plane with origin at Attachment0's position and unit normal vector equal to Attachment0's primary axis.

@roblox/globaltype/StarterGui.documentation: A container for GUI objects to be copied into the PlayerGui of Players. Also provides a range of functions for interacting with the CoreGui.

@roblox/globaltype/StarterGui.ProcessUse.documentation: Allows the StarterGui service to process input like PlayerGui and CoreGui do.

@roblox/globaltype/StarterGui.ResetPlaye.documentation: Determines whether each child parented to the StarterGui will be cloned into a player's PlayerGui when that player's character is respawned.

@roblox/globaltype/StarterGui.ScreenOrie.documentation: Sets the default screen orientation mode for users with mobile devices.

@roblox/globaltype/StarterGui.ShowDevelo.documentation: Determines whether the contents of StarterGui is visible in studio.

@roblox/globaltype/StarterGui.GetCoreGui.documentation: A container for GUI objects to be copied into the PlayerGui of Players. Also provides a range of functions for interacting with the CoreGui.
Returns whether the given CoreGuiTypeis enabled or if it has been disabled using StarterGui:SetCoreGuiEnabled().

@roblox/globaltype/StarterGui.SetCore/pa.documentation: A container for GUI objects to be copied into the PlayerGui of Players. Also provides a range of functions for interacting with the CoreGui.
Selects the functionality with which the call will interact: a CoreScript must have registered such a string already (if one hasn't, an error is raised).

@roblox/globaltype/StarterGui.SetCore.documentation: Allows you to perform certain interactions with Roblox's CoreScripts.
@roblox/globaltype/StarterGui.SetCore.code_sample:
local StarterGui = game:GetService("StarterGui")

StarterGui:SetCore("AvatarContextMenuTheme", {
	BackgroundImage = "",
	BackgroundTransparency = 0.5,
	BackgroundColor = Color3.fromRGB(111, 145, 242),
	NameTagColor = Color3.fromRGB(0, 0, 200),
	NameUnderlineColor = Color3.fromRGB(213, 233, 255),
	ButtonFrameColor = Color3.fromRGB(15, 24, 65),
	ButtonFrameTransparency = 0.2,
	ButtonUnderlineColor = Color3.fromRGB(213, 233, 255),
	Font = Enum.Font.SciFi,
})

@roblox/globaltype/StarterGui.SetCoreGui.documentation: A container for GUI objects to be copied into the PlayerGui of Players. Also provides a range of functions for interacting with the CoreGui.
Whether to enable or disable the given CoreGuiType.
Sets whether the CoreGui element associated with the given CoreGuiType is enabled or disabled.

@roblox/globaltype/StarterGui.GetCore/pa.documentation: A container for GUI objects to be copied into the PlayerGui of Players. Also provides a range of functions for interacting with the CoreGui.

@roblox/globaltype/StarterGui.GetCore.documentation: Returns a variable that has been specified by a Roblox CoreScript.
@roblox/globaltype/StarterGui.GetCore.code_sample:
local StarterGui = game:GetService("StarterGui")

if StarterGui:GetCore("ChatActive") then
	print("Chat is active")
else
	print("Chat is not active")
end

@roblox/globaltype/SurfaceSelection.documentation: Highlights a face of a surface in a configurable color.

@roblox/globaltype/SurfaceSelection.Targ.documentation: Sets which side the SurfaceSelection will appear on, on the adorned BasePart.

@roblox/globaltype/ReflectionMetadataCal.documentation: Acts as a Folder containing information about callbacks for a ReflectionMetadataClass, and should be parented to it. ReflectionMetadataMembers that are parented to this object will be perceived as callbacks under the class this is parented to.

@roblox/globaltype/RemoteFunction.documentation: An object which facilitates synchronous, two-way communication across the client-server boundary. Scripts invoking a RemoteFunction yield until they receive a response from the recipient.

@roblox/globaltype/RemoteFunction.Invoke.documentation: An object which facilitates synchronous, two-way communication across the client-server boundary. Scripts invoking a RemoteFunction yield until they receive a response from the recipient.
The Player associated with the client to invoke.
Values to pass to the OnClientInvoke callback.
Invokes the RemoteFunction which in turn calls the OnClientInvoke callback.
An object which facilitates synchronous, two-way communication across the client-server boundary. Scripts invoking a RemoteFunction yield until they receive a response from the recipient.
Values to pass to the OnServerInvoke callback.
Invokes the RemoteFunction which in turn calls the OnServerInvoke callback.

@roblox/globaltype/RemoteFunction.OnClie.documentation: Values returned by the callback function.
Callback for when the RemoteFunction is invoked with InvokeClient().

@roblox/globaltype/RemoteFunction.OnServ.documentation: The Player associated with the client that the InvokeServer() call originates from.
Values returned by the callback function.
Callback for when the RemoteFunction is invoked with InvokeServer().

@roblox/globaltype/ReflectionMetadataMem.documentation: An internal object which cannot be used by developers.

@roblox/globaltype/GamepadService.documentation: The GamepadService is internally responsible for handling inputs from various controllers, such as Xbox One or PlayStation DualShock controllers.

@roblox/globaltype/GamepadService.Gamepa.documentation: The state of the gamepad virtual cursor.

@roblox/globaltype/GamepadService.Disabl.documentation: The GamepadService is internally responsible for handling inputs from various controllers, such as Xbox One or PlayStation DualShock controllers.
Disables the gamepad cursor, if currently enabled.
@roblox/globaltype/GamepadService.Disabl.code_sample:
local gamepadService = game.GamepadService
local userInputService = game.UserInputService

userInputService.InputBegan:Connect(function(inputObject, gameProcessed)
  if inputObject.KeyCode == Enum.KeyCode.ButtonB then
    gamepadService:DisableGamepadCursor()
  end
end)

@roblox/globaltype/GamepadService.Enable.documentation: The GamepadService is internally responsible for handling inputs from various controllers, such as Xbox One or PlayStation DualShock controllers.
Enables the gamepad cursor or updates its position.
@roblox/globaltype/GamepadService.Enable.code_sample:
local gamepadService = game.GamepadService
local userInputService = game.UserInputService
local startObject = script.Parent

userInputService.InputBegan:Connect(function(inputObject, gameProcessed)
  if inputObject.KeyCode == Enum.KeyCode.ButtonA then
    gamepadService:EnableGamepadCursor(startObject)
  end
end)

@roblox/globaltype/Vector3Value.documentation: A container object for a single Vector3 value.
@roblox/globaltype/Vector3Value.code_sample:
-- Paste me in a Script inside a Part
local part = script.Parent

local teleportPosition = part.TeleportPosition

local function onTouch(otherPart)
	-- First, find the HumanoidRootPart. If we can't find it, exit.
	local hrp = otherPart.Parent:FindFirstChild("HumanoidRootPart")
	if not hrp then
		return
	end

	-- Now teleport by setting the CFrame to one created from
	-- the stored TeleportPosition
	hrp.CFrame = CFrame.new(teleportPosition.Value)
end

part.Touched:Connect(onTouch)

@roblox/globaltype/Vector3Value.Changed..documentation: An object that runs connected functions upon a specific occurrence.
Connects the given function to the event and returns an RBXScriptConnection that represents it.
Yields the current thread until the signal fires and returns the arguments provided by the signal.

@roblox/globaltype/Vector3Value.Changed.code_sample:
local value = Instance.new("Vector3Value")
value.Parent = workspace

value.Changed:Connect(function(NewValue)
	print(NewValue)
end)

value.Value = Vector3.new(10, 10, 10)

@roblox/globaltype/Vector3Value.changed..documentation: An object that runs connected functions upon a specific occurrence.
Connects the given function to the event and returns an RBXScriptConnection that represents it.
Yields the current thread until the signal fires and returns the arguments provided by the signal.

@roblox/globaltype/Accessory.documentation: An item that a Character can wear.

@roblox/globaltype/Accessory.AccessoryTy.documentation: Specifies the AccessoryType of the Accessory (eg. Hat, Tshirt, Waist).

@roblox/globaltype/HumanoidDescription.documentation: Describes the appearance of a Humanoid character including body parts, accessories, colors, scales, animations, and emotes.

@roblox/globaltype/HumanoidDescription.A.documentation: A JSON formatted array of Layered Accessories where each table in the entry in the array describes an accessory's AssetId, AccessoryType, Order, and (optionally) Puffiness as key-value pairs.

@roblox/globaltype/HumanoidDescription.B.documentation: A comma-separated list of asset IDs that will be added as Accessories to a Humanoid rig when applied, usually those attached to its back (such as capes).

Determines the factor by which the shape of a Humanoid rig is interpolated from the standard R15 body shape (0) to a taller and more slender body type (1); when applied, maps to the "BodyTypeScale" NumberValue within the HumanoidDescription.

@roblox/globaltype/HumanoidDescription.C.documentation: When this description is applied to a Humanoid, this determines the Animation.AnimationId to play when its state is Climbing.

@roblox/globaltype/HumanoidDescription.D.documentation: Determines by what factor the depth (back-to-front distance) of a Humanoid rig is scaled; when applied, maps to the "DepthScale" NumberValue within the Humanoid.

@roblox/globaltype/HumanoidDescription.F.documentation: Determines the asset ID of the Face to be applied to the Humanoid.
A comma-separated list of asset IDs that will be added as Accessories to a Humanoid rig when applied, usually those attached to the front of its face (such as glasses).
When this description is applied to a Humanoid, this determines the Animation.AnimationId to play when its state is Freefall.
A comma-separated list of asset IDs that will be added as Accessories to a Humanoid rig when applied, usually those attached to front of its torso (such as medals or ties).

@roblox/globaltype/HumanoidDescription.G.documentation: Determines the Graphic used by a ShirtGraphic when applied.

@roblox/globaltype/HumanoidDescription.H.documentation: A comma-separated list of asset IDs that will be added as Accessories to a Humanoid rig when applied, usually those attached to its head resembling hair.
A comma-separated list of asset IDs that will be added as Accessories to a Humanoid rig when applied, usually those attached to its head.
Determines the asset ID of the Head to be applied to the Humanoid.
Determines the BodyColors.HeadColor3 and BodyColors.HeadColor of a Humanoid when applied.
Determines by what factor the Head of a Humanoid is scaled; when applied, maps to the "HeadScale" NumberValue within the Humanoid.
Determines by what factor the height (top-to-bottom distance) of a Humanoid rig is scaled; when applied, maps to the "HeightScale" NumberValue within the Humanoid.

@roblox/globaltype/HumanoidDescription.I.documentation: When this description is applied to a Humanoid, this determines the Animation.AnimationId to play when its state is Running at a speed near zero.

@roblox/globaltype/HumanoidDescription.J.documentation: When this description is applied to a Humanoid, this determines the Animation.AnimationId to play when its state is Jumping.

@roblox/globaltype/HumanoidDescription.L.documentation: Determines the asset ID of the LeftArm to be applied to the Humanoid.
Determines the BodyColors.LeftArmColor3 and BodyColors.LeftArmColor of a Humanoid when applied.
Determines the asset ID of the LeftLeg to be applied to the Humanoid.
Determines the BodyColors.LeftLegColor3 and BodyColors.LeftLegColor of a Humanoid when applied.

@roblox/globaltype/HumanoidDescription.N.documentation: A comma-separated list of asset IDs that will be added as Accessories to a Humanoid rig when applied, usually those attached to its neck (such as scarves or necklaces).

@roblox/globaltype/HumanoidDescription.P.documentation: Determines the PantsTemplate used by a Pants when applied.
Determines how wide (0) or narrow (1) a Humanoid rig is; when applied, maps to the "BodyProportionScale" NumberValue within the Humanoid.

@roblox/globaltype/HumanoidDescription.R.documentation: Determines the asset ID of the RightArm to be applied to the Humanoid.
Determines the BodyColors.RightArmColor3 and BodyColors.RightArmColor of a Humanoid when applied.
Determines the asset ID of the RightLeg to be applied to the Humanoid.
Determines the BodyColors.RightLegColor3 and BodyColors.RightLegColor of a Humanoid when applied.
When this description is applied to a Humanoid, this determines the Animation.AnimationId to play when its state is Running at a moderate speed.

@roblox/globaltype/HumanoidDescription.S.documentation: Determines the ShirtTemplate used by a Shirt when applied.
A comma-separated list of asset IDs that will be added as Accessories to a Humanoid rig when applied, usually those attached to its shoulders (such as shoulder-mounted critters).
When this description is applied to a Humanoid, this determines the Animation.AnimationId to play when its state is Swimming.

@roblox/globaltype/HumanoidDescription.T.documentation: Determines the asset ID of the Torso to be applied to the Humanoid.
Determines the BodyColors.TorsoColor3 and BodyColors.TorsoColor of a Humanoid when applied.

@roblox/globaltype/HumanoidDescription.W.documentation: A comma-separated list of asset IDs that will be added as Accessories to a Humanoid rig when applied, usually those attached to its waist (such as belts).
When this description is applied to a Humanoid, this determines the Animation.AnimationId to play when its state is Running at a low speed.
Determines by what factor the width (left-to-right distance) of a Humanoid is scaled; when applied, maps to the "BodyWidthScale" NumberValue within the Humanoid.

@roblox/globaltype/HumanoidDescription.A.documentation: Describes the appearance of a Humanoid character including body parts, accessories, colors, scales, animations, and emotes.
A string that identifies what emote is being added. Example: "Salute".
Adds the emote to the description given a name and its asset ID.

@roblox/globaltype/HumanoidDescription.G.documentation: Describes the appearance of a Humanoid character including body parts, accessories, colors, scales, animations, and emotes.
Set to true if rigid accessories from the rigid accessory properties should also be included in the return array. False means only include layered clothing accessories from the AccessoryBlob.

@roblox/globaltype/MemoryStoreSortedMap.documentation: Provides access to a sorted map within MemoryStore.

@roblox/globaltype/MemoryStoreSortedMap..documentation: Provides access to a sorted map within MemoryStore.
Key whose value and sort key to retrieve.

A tuple of two values:
  • Key value, or nil -- if there's no item with the specified key.
  • Sort key, or nil -- if there's no sort key associated with the specified key.
Retrieves the value and sort key of a key in the sorted map.
Provides access to a sorted map within MemoryStore.
Sort direction, ascending or descending.
The number of items to retrieve; the maximum allowed value for this parameter is 200.
(Optional) Lower bound, exclusive, for the returned keys. This is provided as a table where one or both of key and sort key can be specified: { key: string, sortKey: Variant } .
(Optional) Upper bound, exclusive, for the returned keys. This is provided as a table where one or both of key and sort key can be specified: { key: string, sortKey: Variant } .
Item keys, values and sort keys in the requested range.
Retrieves items within a sorted range of keys and sort keys.
Provides access to a sorted map within MemoryStore.
Key to remove.
Removes the provided key from the sorted map.
Provides access to a sorted map within MemoryStore.
Key whose value to set.
Key value to set.
Item expiration, in seconds. The item is automatically removed from the sorted map once the expiration duration is reached. The maximum expiration time is 45 days (3,888,000 seconds).
(Optional) Sort key to set for this key. Accepted types are a number (integer or decimal) or a string.
Sets the value of a key.
Provides access to a sorted map within MemoryStore.
Key whose value to update.
A function which you need to provide. The function takes the key's old value and old sort key as input and returns the new value and new sort key.
Item expiration time, in seconds, after which the item will be automatically removed from the sorted map. The maximum expiration time is 45 days (3,888,000 seconds).
The return value is a tuple of the last value and sort key returned by the transform function.
Retrieves the value and sort key of a key from a sorted map and updates it with a new value and sort key.
@roblox/globaltype/MemoryStoreSortedMap..code_sample:
local MemoryStoreService = game:GetService("MemoryStoreService")
local map = MemoryStoreService:GetSortedMap("Leaderboard")
local Players = game:GetService("Players")

function updateLeaderboard(itemKey, killsToAdd, deathsToAdd)
	local success, newStats, newScore = pcall(function()
		return map:UpdateAsync(itemKey, function(playerStats, playerScore)
			playerStats = playerStats or { kills = 0, deaths = 0 }
			playerStats.kills += killsToAdd
			playerStats.deaths += deathsToAdd
			if playerStats then
				-- `playerScore` is the sortKey being used to sort items in the map
				playerScore = playerStats.kills / math.max(playerStats.deaths, 1)
				return playerStats, playerScore
			end
			return nil
		end, 30)
	end)
end

-- Add one kill to all players
for i, player in pairs(Players:GetPlayers()) do
	updateLeaderboard(player.UserId, 1, 0)
end
-- Add 5 kills and 1 death to player with userId 12345
updateLeaderboard(12345, 5, 1)

@roblox/globaltype/Decal.Transparency.code_sample:
local TweenService = game:GetService("TweenService")

local part = Instance.new("Part")
part.Size = Vector3.new(10, 10, 1)
part.Position = Vector3.new(0, 5, 0)
part.Anchored = true
part.Transparency = 1

local decal = Instance.new("Decal")
decal.Face = Enum.NormalId.Front
decal.Texture = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=699259085" -- roblox logo
decal.Parent = part

part.Parent = workspace

local tween = TweenService:Create(
	decal,
	TweenInfo.new(1, Enum.EasingStyle.Linear, Enum.EasingDirection.Out, -1, true),
	{ Transparency = 1 }
)

tween:Play()

@roblox/globaltype/IntValue.documentation: A container object for a single integer.
@roblox/globaltype/IntValue.code_sample:
-- These are the constraints for a 32-bit signed integer
local INT_MAX = 2 ^ 31 - 1
local INT_MIN = -(2 ^ 31)

local vInteger = Instance.new("IntValue")
vInteger.Changed:Connect(print)
-- Some small values
vInteger.Value = 5
vInteger.Value = 0
vInteger.Value = -0 -- No change - same as 0
-- Min value
vInteger.Value = INT_MIN
-- Max value
vInteger.Value = INT_MAX
-- Max value plus one; this causes integer overflow!
-- The IntValue changes to INT_MIN!
vInteger.Value = INT_MAX + 1

@roblox/globaltype/TextLabel.documentation: A 2D user interface element that displays non-interactive text.
@roblox/globaltype/TextLabel.code_sample:
-- Place this code in a LocalScript within a TextLabel/TextButton
local textLabel = script.Parent

-- Some colors we'll use with TextColor3
local colorNormal = Color3.new(0, 0, 0) -- black
local colorSoon = Color3.new(1, 0.5, 0.5) -- red
local colorDone = Color3.new(0.5, 1, 0.5) -- green

-- Loop infinitely
while true do
	-- Count backwards from 10 to 1
	for i = 10, 1, -1 do
		-- Set the text
		textLabel.Text = "Time: " .. i
		-- Set the color based on how much time is left
		if i > 3 then
			textLabel.TextColor3 = colorNormal
		else
			textLabel.TextColor3 = colorSoon
		end
		task.wait(1)
	end
	textLabel.Text = "GO!"
	textLabel.TextColor3 = colorDone
	task.wait(2)
end

@roblox/globaltype/TextLabel.ContentText.documentation: A copy of TextLabel.Text that contains exactly what is being rendered by the TextLabel.

@roblox/globaltype/TextLabel.Font.documentation: Determines the font used to render text.
@roblox/globaltype/TextLabel.Font.code_sample:
local textLabel = script.Parent

while true do
	-- Iterate over all the different fonts
	for _, font in pairs(Enum.Font:GetEnumItems()) do
		textLabel.Font = font
		textLabel.Text = font.Name
		task.wait(1)
	end
end

@roblox/globaltype/TextLabel.MaxVisibleG.documentation: The maximum number of graphemes the TextLabel can show.
@roblox/globaltype/TextLabel.MaxVisibleG.code_sample:
local TweenService = game:GetService("TweenService")

local textObject = script.Parent

local tweenInfo = TweenInfo.new(
	4, -- it takes 4 seconds for the effect to complete
	Enum.EasingStyle.Sine, -- typing starts fast and slows near the end
	Enum.EasingDirection.Out
)

local tween = TweenService:Create(textObject, tweenInfo, {
	-- Final value should be the total grapheme count
	MaxVisibleGraphemes = utf8.len(textObject.ContentText),
})

tween:Play()
tween.Completed:Wait()

-- Reset the value so it can be tweened again
textObject.MaxVisibleGraphemes = -1

@roblox/globaltype/TextLabel.RichText.documentation: Determines whether the TextLabel renders the TextLabel.Text string using rich text formatting.

@roblox/globaltype/TextLabel.Text.documentation: Determines the string rendered by the UI element.

@roblox/globaltype/TextLabel.TextBounds.documentation: The size of a UI element's text in offsets.

@roblox/globaltype/TextLabel.TextColor3.documentation: This property determines the color of rendered text.
@roblox/globaltype/TextLabel.TextColor3.code_sample:
local textBox = script.Parent

local function hasVowels(str)
	return str:lower():find("[aeiou]")
end

local function onTextChanged()
	local text = textBox.Text
	-- Check for vowels
	if hasVowels(text) then
		textBox.TextColor3 = Color3.new(0, 0, 0) -- Black
	else
		textBox.TextColor3 = Color3.new(1, 0, 0) -- Red
	end
end

textBox:GetPropertyChangedSignal("Text"):Connect(onTextChanged)

textLabel.Text = "Kaboom!"

while true do
	for size = 5, 100, 5 do
		textLabel.TextSize = size
		textLabel.TextTransparency = size / 100
		task.wait()
	end
	task.wait(1)
end

@roblox/globaltype/TextLabel.TextXAlignm.documentation: Determines the horizontal alignment of rendered text.
@roblox/globaltype/TextLabel.TextXAlignm.code_sample:
-- Paste this in a LocalScript within a TextLabel/TextButton/TextBox
local textLabel = script.Parent

local function setAlignment(xAlign, yAlign)
	textLabel.TextXAlignment = xAlign
	textLabel.TextYAlignment = yAlign
	textLabel.Text = xAlign.Name .. " + " .. yAlign.Name
end

while true do
	-- Iterate over both TextXAlignment and TextYAlignment enum items
	for _, yAlign in pairs(Enum.TextYAlignment:GetEnumItems()) do
		for _, xAlign in pairs(Enum.TextXAlignment:GetEnumItems()) do
			setAlignment(xAlign, yAlign)
			task.wait(1)
		end
	end
end

@roblox/globaltype/TextLabel.TextYAlignm.documentation: Determines the vertical alignment of rendered text.
@roblox/globaltype/TextLabel.TextYAlignm.code_sample:
-- Paste this in a LocalScript within a TextLabel/TextButton/TextBox

local function setAlignment(xAlign, yAlign)
	textLabel.TextXAlignment = xAlign
	textLabel.TextYAlignment = yAlign
	textLabel.Text = xAlign.Name .. " + " .. yAlign.Name
end

while true do
	-- Iterate over both TextXAlignment and TextYAlignment enum items
	for _, yAlign in pairs(Enum.TextYAlignment:GetEnumItems()) do
		for _, xAlign in pairs(Enum.TextXAlignment:GetEnumItems()) do
			setAlignment(xAlign, yAlign)
			task.wait(1)
		end
	end
end

@roblox/globaltype/StarterPack.documentation: A service-level container whose contents are copied into each player's Backpack when the player spawns. It is generally used to hold Tools, but is sometimes used to hold LocalScripts to ensure that each player gets a copy.
@roblox/globaltype/StarterPack.code_sample:
local StarterPack = game:GetService("StarterPack")

local function emptyStarterPack()
	for _, child in pairs(StarterPack:GetChildren()) do
		if child:IsA("Tool") then
			child:Destroy()
		end
	end
end

@roblox/globaltype/Pose.documentation: Holds the CFrame applied to the Motor6D connected to its associated BasePart. The part which is controlled depends on the name of the Pose.

@roblox/globaltype/Pose.CFrame.documentation: This CFrame applies to the Motor6D corresponding with the Pose when the Motor6D.Transform is changed.

@roblox/globaltype/Pose.AddSubPose/param.documentation: Holds the CFrame applied to the Motor6D connected to its associated BasePart. The part which is controlled depends on the name of the Pose.

@roblox/globaltype/Pose.AddSubPose.documentation: Adds a sub Pose to the Pose by parenting it.
@roblox/globaltype/Pose.AddSubPose.code_sample:
local keyframe = Instance.new("Keyframe")
keyframe.Parent = workspace

local pose = Instance.new("Pose")
pose.EasingStyle = Enum.PoseEasingStyle.Cubic
pose.EasingDirection = Enum.PoseEasingDirection.Out

local pose2 = Instance.new("Pose")
pose2.EasingStyle = Enum.PoseEasingStyle.Cubic
pose2.EasingDirection = Enum.PoseEasingDirection.Out

keyframe:AddPose(pose) -- pose.Parent = keyframe

task.wait(2)

keyframe:RemovePose(pose) -- pose.Parent = nil

task.wait(2)

keyframe:AddPose(pose) -- pose.Parent = keyframe

task.wait(2)

pose:AddSubPose(pose2) -- pose2.Parent = pose

task.wait(2)

pose:RemoveSubPose(pose2) -- pose2.Parent = nil

@roblox/globaltype/Pose.GetSubPoses/para.documentation: Holds the CFrame applied to the Motor6D connected to its associated BasePart. The part which is controlled depends on the name of the Pose.

@roblox/globaltype/Pose.GetSubPoses.documentation: Returns an array containing all sub Poses that have been added to a Pose.

@roblox/globaltype/Pose.RemoveSubPose/pa.documentation: Holds the CFrame applied to the Motor6D connected to its associated BasePart. The part which is controlled depends on the name of the Pose.

@roblox/globaltype/Pose.RemoveSubPose.documentation: Removes a sub Pose from the Pose by parenting it to nil.
@roblox/globaltype/Pose.RemoveSubPose.code_sample:
local keyframe = Instance.new("Keyframe")
keyframe.Parent = workspace

local pose = Instance.new("Pose")
pose.EasingStyle = Enum.PoseEasingStyle.Cubic
pose.EasingDirection = Enum.PoseEasingDirection.Out

local pose2 = Instance.new("Pose")
pose2.EasingStyle = Enum.PoseEasingStyle.Cubic
pose2.EasingDirection = Enum.PoseEasingDirection.Out

keyframe:AddPose(pose) -- pose.Parent = keyframe

task.wait(2)

keyframe:RemovePose(pose) -- pose.Parent = nil

task.wait(2)

keyframe:AddPose(pose) -- pose.Parent = keyframe

task.wait(2)

pose:AddSubPose(pose2) -- pose2.Parent = pose

task.wait(2)

pose:RemoveSubPose(pose2) -- pose2.Parent = nil

@roblox/globaltype/AudioCompressor.documentation: Adjusts the dynamic range of input streams.
@roblox/globaltype/AudioCompressor.code_sample:
local deviceOutput: AudioDeviceOutput = Instance.new("AudioDeviceOutput")
deviceOutput.Parent = workspace
local explosionPlayer: AudioPlayer = Instance.new("AudioPlayer")
explosionPlayer.Parent = workspace
explosionPlayer.AssetId = "rbxassetid://1835333184"

local ambiencePlayer = Instance.new("AudioPlayer")
ambiencePlayer.AssetId = "rbxassetid://9112854440"
local compressor = Instance.new("AudioCompressor")
local wireToCompressor = Instance.new("Wire")
local wireToSidechain = Instance.new("Wire")
local wireToOutput = Instance.new("Wire")

ambiencePlayer.Parent = workspace
compressor.Parent = workspace
wireToCompressor.Parent = workspace
wireToSidechain.Parent = workspace
wireToOutput.Parent = workspace

wireToCompressor.SourceInstance = ambiencePlayer
wireToCompressor.TargetInstance = compressor

wireToSidechain.SourceInstance = explosionPlayer
wireToSidechain.TargetInstance = compressor
wireToSidechain.TargetName = "Sidechain"

wireToOutput.SourceInstance = compressor
wireToOutput.TargetInstance = deviceOutput

ambiencePlayer:Play()

@roblox/globaltype/AudioCompressor.Attac.documentation: Controls how quickly the compressor will clamp down on volume after it surpasses Threshold.

@roblox/globaltype/AudioCompressor.Ratio.documentation: Ratio of input volume to output volume, to be applied when surpassing Threshold.

@roblox/globaltype/AudioCompressor.Relea.documentation: Controls how quickly the compressor will unclamp after the stream volume dips back below Threshold.

@roblox/globaltype/AudioCompressor.Thres.documentation: Gain value at which the compressor will start to modify the input stream.

@roblox/globaltype/AudioCompressor.GetCo.documentation: Adjusts the dynamic range of input streams.

@roblox/globaltype/NumberValue.documentation: A container object for a single double-precision floating point number.
@roblox/globaltype/NumberValue.code_sample:
-- Demonstrate the Changed event by creating a Part
local part = Instance.new("Part")
part.Changed:Connect(print)
-- This fires Changed with "Transparency"
part.Transparency = 0.5
-- Similarly, this fires Changed with "Number"
part.Name = "SomePart"
-- Since changing BrickColor will also change other
-- properties at the same time, this line fires Changed
-- with "BrickColor", "Color3" and "Color3uint16".
part.BrickColor = BrickColor.Red()

-- A NumberValue holds a double-precision floating-point number
local vNumber = Instance.new("NumberValue")
vNumber.Changed:Connect(print)
-- This fires Changed with 123.456 (not "Value")
vNumber.Value = 123.456
-- This does not fire Changed
vNumber.Name = "SomeNumber"

-- A StringValue stores one string
local vString = Instance.new("StringValue")
vString.Changed:Connect(print)
-- This fires Changed with "Hello" (not "Value")
vString.Value = "Hello"

@roblox/globaltype/NumberValue.Value.documentation: Used to hold a double value.

@roblox/globaltype/Tool.documentation: An object, such as a weapon, that can be equipped by a Humanoid.
@roblox/globaltype/Tool.code_sample:
local tool = script.Parent

local function explode(point)
	local e = Instance.new("Explosion")
	e.DestroyJointRadiusPercent = 0 -- Make the explosion non-deadly
	e.Position = point
	e.Parent = workspace
end

local function onActivated()
	-- Get the Humanoid that Activated the tool
	local human = tool.Parent.Humanoid
	-- Call explode with the current point the Humanoid is targetting
	explode(human.TargetPoint)
end

tool.Activated:Connect(onActivated)

@roblox/globaltype/Tool.CanBeDropped.documentation: Controls whether the player can drop the tool.
@roblox/globaltype/Tool.CanBeDropped.code_sample:
local Players = game:GetService("Players")

local player = Players.LocalPlayer

local backpack = player:WaitForChild("Backpack")

local tool = Instance.new("Tool")
tool.Name = "I AM CAT"
tool.RequiresHandle = false
tool.CanBeDropped = false
tool.Parent = backpack

local function onToolActivated()
	print("Meow")
end

tool.Activated:Connect(onToolActivated)

@roblox/globaltype/Tool.Enabled.documentation: Relates to whether or not the tool can be used.
@roblox/globaltype/Tool.Enabled.code_sample:
local Players = game:GetService("Players")

local player = Players.LocalPlayer
local character = player.Character or player.CharacterAdded:Wait()
local humanoid = character:WaitForChild("Humanoid")

local tool = Instance.new("Tool")
tool.Name = "SuperJump"
tool.RequiresHandle = false
tool.Parent = player.Backpack

function toolActivated()
	humanoid.JumpPower = 150
	tool.Enabled = false
	task.wait(5)
	tool.Enabled = true
	humanoid.JumpPower = 50
end

tool.Activated:Connect(toolActivated)
tool.Unequipped:Connect(function()
	humanoid.JumpPower = 50
end)

@roblox/globaltype/Tool.Grip.documentation: Stores the tool's "grip" properties as one CFrame.
@roblox/globaltype/Tool.Grip.code_sample:
local Players = game:GetService("Players")

local player = Players.LocalPlayer

local tool = Instance.new("Tool")
tool.Name = "Stick"
tool.Parent = player.Backpack

local handle = Instance.new("Part")
handle.Name = "Handle"
handle.Parent = tool
handle.Size = Vector3.new(0.1, 3, 0.1)
handle.Color = Color3.fromRGB(108, 88, 75) -- Brown

tool.Activated:Connect(function()
	print(tool.Grip)
	print(tool.GripUp)
	print(tool.GripRight)
	print(tool.GripForward)
	print(tool.GripPos)
end)

tool.Name = "Sprint"

	tool.ManualActivationOnly = true
	task.wait(5)

@roblox/globaltype/Tool.Deactivate.code_sample:
local ContextActionService = game:GetService("ContextActionService")

local tool = script.Parent

-- Gives Handle within Tool a random BrickColor
local function toolDeactivated()
	tool.Handle.BrickColor = BrickColor.random()
end

-- Deactivates the tool when any key is pressed down
local function keyPressed(_actionName, actionInputState, _actionInputObject)
	if actionInputState == Enum.UserInputState.Begin then
		tool:Deactivate()
	end
end

tool.Deactivated:Connect(toolDeactivated)
ContextActionService:BindAction("deactivateTool", keyPressed, true, "x")

@roblox/globaltype/Seat.documentation: A type of BasePart that characters can 'sit' in. When a character touches an enabled Seat object, it will be attached to the part by a Weld and the default character scripts will play a sitting animation.
@roblox/globaltype/Seat.code_sample:
local Players = game:GetService("Players")

local seat = Instance.new("Seat")
seat.Anchored = true
seat.Position = Vector3.new(0, 1, 0)
seat.Parent = workspace

local currentPlayer = nil

local function onOccupantChanged()
	local humanoid = seat.Occupant
	if humanoid then
		local character = humanoid.Parent
		local player = Players:GetPlayerFromCharacter(character)
		if player then
			print(player.Name .. " has sat down")
			currentPlayer = player
			return
		end
	end
	if currentPlayer then
		print(currentPlayer.Name .. " has got up")
		currentPlayer = nil
	end
end

seat:GetPropertyChangedSignal("Occupant"):Connect(onOccupantChanged)

@roblox/globaltype/Seat.Disabled.documentation: Whether or not the seat is usable. If set to true, the seat will act as a normal part.

@roblox/globaltype/Seat.Sit/param/0.documentation: A type of BasePart that characters can 'sit' in. When a character touches an enabled Seat object, it will be attached to the part by a Weld and the default character scripts will play a sitting animation.

@roblox/globaltype/Seat.Sit.documentation: Forces the character with the specified Humanoid to sit in the Seat.
