@roblox/enum/VelocityConstraintMode.Vect.documentation:
The velocity components must be equal to the vector components specified. The coordinate system of the vector is based on the RelativeTo property:
  • Attachment0 - The vector components are in the coordinate system defined by the axes of Attachment0.
  • Attachment1 - The vector components are in the coordinate system defined by the axes of Attachment1.
  • World - The coordinate system is in the world and the vector components must be specified.

@roblox/enum/VelocityConstraintMode.documentation: The velocity constraint mode property controls how the linear velocity of the attachment(s) is constrained.

@roblox/enum/CustomCameraMode.Default.documentation: The default camera mode is classic.

@roblox/enum/CustomCameraMode.Classic.documentation: Camera tracks the player but will not automatically rotate if the player walks left or right.

@roblox/enum/CustomCameraMode.Follow.documentation: Camera tracks the player and automatically rotates if the player walks left or right.

@roblox/enum/CustomCameraMode.documentation: Changes the player's camera mode in Roblox's Game settings.

@roblox/enum/VerticalScrollBarPosition.documentation: Indicates the side that the vertical scrollbar will be located at.

@roblox/enum/ElasticBehavior.WhenScrolla.documentation: The scrollbar will be elastic when there is content to be scrolled to.

@roblox/enum/ElasticBehavior.Always.documentation: The scrollbar will always have elastic scrolling available, even when there isn't content available to scroll to.

@roblox/enum/ElasticBehavior.Never.documentation: The scrollbar will never have elastic scrolling available.

@roblox/enum/ElasticBehavior.documentation: This enum is used by ScrollingFrame.ElasticBehavior to specifies how elastic scrolling behaves for a ScrollingFrame.

@roblox/enum/SurfaceGuiSizingMode.FixedS.documentation: Renders with a fixed size set using SurfaceGui.CanvasSize.

@roblox/enum/SurfaceGuiSizingMode.Pixels.documentation: Renders with a variable size based on SurfaceGui.PixelsPerStud and the SurfaceGui's size in studs.

@roblox/enum/SurfaceGuiSizingMode.documentation: Used by SurfaceGui.SizingMode to control the sizing behavior of a SurfaceGui.

@roblox/enum/ComputerCameraMovementMode..documentation: The default camera movement mode is classic.
Camera tracks the player but will not automatically rotate if the player walks left or right.
Camera tracks the player and automatically rotates if the player walks left or right.
The camera has a fixed Y position, but can be rotated around the player.
The camera toggles between locked and free rotation with the right mouse button.

@roblox/enum/ComputerCameraMovementMode.documentation: The camera movement mode currently in-use by the client.

@roblox/enum/GuiState.Idle.documentation: The GUI currently has no state.

@roblox/enum/GuiState.Hover.documentation: The GUI is being hovered over by the user.

@roblox/enum/GuiState.Press.documentation: The GUI is being pressed/held down by the user.

@roblox/enum/GuiState.NonInteractable.documentation: The GUI cannot be interacted with and therefore has no states.

@roblox/enum/JointCreationMode.All.documentation: Joints are created between any kind of surface. Functions identically to Surface.

@roblox/enum/JointCreationMode.Surface.documentation: Joints are created between any kind of surface. Functions identically to All.

@roblox/enum/JointCreationMode.None.documentation: Joints are never created, no matter what.

@roblox/enum/JointCreationMode.documentation: The way joints are created between two surfaces.

@roblox/enum/MessageType.MessageOutput.documentation: The message is from the standard output channel.

@roblox/enum/MessageType.MessageInfo.documentation: The message is from the information channel.

@roblox/enum/MessageType.MessageWarning.documentation: The message is from the warning channel.

@roblox/enum/MessageType.MessageError.documentation: The message is from the error channel.

@roblox/enum/StreamingPauseMode.Default.documentation: Default behavior (currently no change to gameplay).

@roblox/enum/StreamingPauseMode.Disabled.documentation: No change to gameplay due to streaming region availability.

@roblox/enum/StreamingPauseMode.documentation: Determines how a Players client should handle not having enough content streamed in to continue playing properly.

@roblox/enum/AssetTypeVerification.Defau.documentation: Use the default behavior for asset type verification.

@roblox/enum/AssetTypeVerification.Clien.documentation: Only verify asset types on the client. Asset type verification can not be turned off on the client.

@roblox/enum/AssetTypeVerification.Alway.documentation: Always verify the asset types to be loaded and disallow loading models.

@roblox/enum/AssetTypeVerification.documentation: Determines the asset type verification mode.

@roblox/enum/AlignType.PrimaryAxisParall.documentation: Aligns the primary axis to be parallel to the axis given by Constraint.Attachment1.

@roblox/enum/AlignType.PrimaryAxisPerpen.documentation: Aligns the primary axis to be perpendicular to the axis given by Constraint.Attachment1.

@roblox/enum/AlignType.PrimaryAxisLookAt.documentation: Aligns the primary axis to look at the point given by Constraint.Attachment1 or the AlignOrientation.LookAtPosition.

@roblox/enum/AlignType.AllAxes.documentation: Aligns all of the axes of Constraint.Attachment0 to the axes given by Constraint.Attachment1 or to the target orientation provided by AlignOrientation.PrimaryAxis and AlignOrientation.SecondaryAxis.

@roblox/enum/AlignType.documentation: An enum that specifies how the constraint will attempt to align the body associated with the constraint.

@roblox/enum/RenderFidelity.Automatic.documentation: Dynamically control a solid modeled and mesh part's level of detail depending on its distance from the camera (see table above).

@roblox/enum/RenderFidelity.Precise.documentation: Specifically set a solid modeled and mesh part's level of detail regardless of its distance from the camera (lowest, medium, or highest).

@roblox/enum/RenderFidelity.Performance.documentation: Push performance as much as possible, trying to maintain quality if possible, and discarding appearance if that's necessary to reach performance. This means that the performance will always be excellent, but mesh visuals may be affected negatively.

@roblox/enum/RenderFidelity.documentation: Determines the level of detail that solid modeled and mesh parts will be shown in.

@roblox/enum/DragDetectorPermissionPolic.documentation: No players can interact with the DragDetector.
All players can interact with the DragDetector.
Invokes the function registered via DragDetector:SetPermissionPolicyFunction(), enabling/disabling the detector based on whether the function returns true or false.
Used to control the permission level for which players can interact with a DragDetector.

@roblox/enum/DragDetectorResponseStyle.G.documentation: For an Anchored object both inside the running experience and in Studio edit mode, the position/orientation of the object will be updated to exactly reflect the proposed motion. For an unanchored object, behavior is the same as for an anchored object; however, in a running experience, the object will be anchored at the start of the drag and restored to unanchored upon drag release.

@roblox/enum/DragDetectorResponseStyle.P.documentation: An Anchored object will default to Geometric behavior as it is not affected by forces. An unanchored object will be moved by constraint forces that attempt to bring it to the desired position and/or orientation given by the proposed motion.

@roblox/enum/DragDetectorResponseStyle.C.documentation: The object will not move at all, but DragFrame will still be updated and you can respond to drag manipulation however you'd like.

@roblox/enum/DragDetectorResponseStyle.documentation: Describes how the clicked object will be treated once the desired motion has been calculated.

@roblox/enum/Limb.Head.documentation: If the limb is a part of the Humanoid's Head.

@roblox/enum/Limb.Torso.documentation: If the limb is a part of the Humanoid's Torso. This includes UpperTorso and LowerTorso for R15 rigs.

@roblox/enum/Limb.LeftArm.documentation: If the limb is a part of the Humanoid's Left Arm. This includes UpperLeftArm, LowerLeftArm, and LeftHand for R15 rigs.

@roblox/enum/Limb.RightArm.documentation: If the limb is a part of the Humanoid's Right Arm. This includes UpperRightArm, LowerRightArm and RightHand for R15 rigs.

@roblox/enum/Limb.LeftLeg.documentation: If the limb is a part of the Humanoid's Left Leg. This includes UpperLeftLeg, LowerLeftLeg and LeftFoot for R15 rigs.

@roblox/enum/Limb.RightLeg.documentation: If the limb is a part of the Humanoid's Right Leg. This includes UpperRightLeg, LowerRightLeg, and RightFoot for R15 rigs.

@roblox/enum/Limb.Unknown.documentation: If a part is not a limb (e.g. running the Humanoid:GetLimb() function and passing it an accessory which is a sibling of the Humanoid will return this value).

@roblox/enum/Limb.documentation: Describes which limb a particular Instance belongs to (assuming the Instance is part of a Humanoid).

@roblox/enum/HorizontalAlignment.Center.documentation: The grid is placed at the center of its parent (x-direction), extending equally to the left and right of the center according to the size of the grid relative to the x-axis.

@roblox/enum/HorizontalAlignment.Left.documentation: The grid is placed starting along the left edge of the parent, extending to the right according to the size of the grid relative to the x-axis.

@roblox/enum/HorizontalAlignment.Right.documentation: The grid is placed starting along the left edge of the parent, extending to the left according to the size of the grid relative to the x-axis.

@roblox/enum/HorizontalAlignment.documentation: Used by UIGridStyleLayout.HorizontalAlignment to align the layout within its parent.

@roblox/enum/StartCorner.TopLeft.documentation: Grid starts in top left corner.

@roblox/enum/StartCorner.TopRight.documentation: Grid starts in top right corner.

@roblox/enum/StartCorner.BottomLeft.documentation: Grid starts in bottom left corner.

@roblox/enum/StartCorner.BottomRight.documentation: Grid starts in bottom right corner.

@roblox/enum/StartCorner.documentation: Used by UIGridLayout.StartCorner to decide where the first element is placed.

@roblox/enum/CameraMode.Classic.documentation: Third person camera which can be zoomed into first person.

@roblox/enum/CameraMode.documentation: Used to set Player.CameraMode to determine when first person and third person cameras should be used.

@roblox/enum/TableMajorAxis.RowMajor.documentation: The direct siblings are considered rows.

@roblox/enum/TableMajorAxis.ColumnMajor.documentation: The direct siblings are considered columns.

@roblox/enum/TableMajorAxis.documentation: Used by UITableLayout.MajorAxis to decide whether direct siblings are rows or columns.

@roblox/enum/ProductLocationRestriction..documentation: Item is purchasable only in the Marketplace.
Item is purchasable in the Marketplace and experiences owned by the item creator.
(Default) Item is purchasable in the Marketplace and all experiences.

@roblox/enum/StreamingIntegrityMode.Disa.documentation: Simulation of the replication focus is never paused, regardless of the amount of content streamed in on the client.

@roblox/enum/StreamingIntegrityMode.Mini.documentation: All client-side simulation is paused when content is not streamed in up to the minimum radius.

@roblox/enum/StreamingIntegrityMode.Paus.documentation: Simulation of the replication focus is paused when any part of its bounding box is not in a streamed-in area.

@roblox/enum/StreamingIntegrityMode.documentation: Determines how a user's client should handle not having enough content streamed in.

@roblox/enum/DebuggerPauseReason.Unknown.documentation: Pausing for a reason not covered by other values.

@roblox/enum/DebuggerPauseReason.Excepti.documentation: Pausing on error hit in the code.

@roblox/enum/DebuggerPauseReason.SingleS.documentation: Pausing on an internal breakpoint set by debugger command: e.g. step over, step into, step out of.

@roblox/enum/DebuggerPauseReason.Entrypo.documentation: Pausing at the entry on the script.

@roblox/enum/DebuggerPauseReason.documentation: Reason that the DataModel was paused.

@roblox/enum/AnimationPriority.Idle.documentation: (6) - Recommended priority for character idle animations.

@roblox/enum/AnimationPriority.Movement.documentation: (5) - Recommended priority for walk, run, swim, climb, and other locomotion animations.

@roblox/enum/AnimationPriority.Action.documentation: (4) - Recommended priority for character actions that must override idle and locomotion animations.

@roblox/enum/AnimationPriority.Action4.documentation: (1) - Action4 is the highest priority available, overriding all other priority values.

@roblox/enum/AnimationPriority.Core.documentation: (7) - Lowest priority, intended for use by Roblox default animations and catalog animation bundles.

@roblox/enum/AnimationPriority.documentation: The AnimationPriority Enum determines how concurrently-playing AnimationTracks contribute to the final animation.

@roblox/enum/R15CollisionType.OuterBox.documentation: Dynamically sized collision boxes based on mesh sizes.

@roblox/enum/R15CollisionType.InnerBox.documentation: Fixed size collision boxes, similar to the classic avatar collision.

@roblox/enum/R15CollisionType.documentation: Collision behavior type for a R15 character.

@roblox/enum/QualityLevel.Automatic.documentation: The quality level of graphics is determined automatically depending on the client's setting for either game performance or graphic quality.

@roblox/enum/QualityLevel.Level01.documentation: Graphic quality level 1 - the lowest quality level.

@roblox/enum/QualityLevel.Level21.documentation: Graphic quality level 21, the highest quality level.

@roblox/enum/QualityLevel.documentation: Controls the rendering quality of the game.

@roblox/enum/DebuggerEndReason.ServerShu.documentation: Server terminated the connection because it shut down.

@roblox/enum/DebuggerEndReason.ServerPro.documentation: Server has wrong version of protocol.

@roblox/enum/DebuggerEndReason.Configura.documentation: Got a failure response when trying to configure the server.

@roblox/enum/DebuggerEndReason.RpcError.documentation: An error occurred in the RPC layer.

@roblox/enum/DebuggerEndReason.documentation: Reason for the end of the debugger session.

@roblox/enum/ThreadPoolConfig.Auto.documentation: Let task scheduler make a decision internally.

@roblox/enum/ThreadPoolConfig.Threads1.documentation: Utilize 1 worker thread, ignore the physical CPU core count.

@roblox/enum/ThreadPoolConfig.Threads2.documentation: Utilize 2 worker threads, ignore the physical CPU core count.

@roblox/enum/ThreadPoolConfig.Threads3.documentation: Utilize 3 worker threads, ignore the physical CPU core count.

@roblox/enum/ThreadPoolConfig.Threads4.documentation: Utilize 4 worker threads, ignore the physical CPU core count.

@roblox/enum/ThreadPoolConfig.Threads8.documentation: Utilize 8 worker threads, ignore the physical CPU core count.

@roblox/enum/ThreadPoolConfig.Threads16.documentation: Utilize 16 worker threads, ignore the physical CPU core count.

@roblox/enum/ThreadPoolConfig.PerCore1.documentation: Utilize 1 worker thread per available physical CPU core.

@roblox/enum/ThreadPoolConfig.PerCore2.documentation: Utilize 2 worker threads per available physical CPU core.

@roblox/enum/ThreadPoolConfig.PerCore3.documentation: Utilize 3 worker threads per available physical CPU core.

@roblox/enum/ThreadPoolConfig.PerCore4.documentation: Utilize 4 worker threads per available physical CPU core.

@roblox/enum/ThreadPoolConfig.documentation: Thread pooling scheme for the task scheduler.

@roblox/enum/ContextActionPriority.documentation: Describes the priority of a context action.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidCollisionType.Outer.documentation: Dynamically sized collision boxes based on mesh sizes.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidCollisionType.Inner.documentation: Fixed size collision boxes, similar to the classic avatar collision.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidCollisionType.documentation: The collision Humanoid uses. A large bounding box, or more fitted collision geometry.

@roblox/enum/TextureQueryType.NonHumanoi.documentation: Texture memory for objects other than Humanoid.
Unreferenced texture memory for objects other than Humanoid.

@roblox/enum/TextureQueryType.documentation: Used to get memory information about textures.

@roblox/enum/LoadCharacterLayeredClothin.documentation: The behavior of the default setting is not constant. It can mean Disabled or Enabled depending on what the global back-end flag settings are currently.
This means layered clothing will not be equipped on characters in the experience.
This means layered clothing will be equipped on characters in the experience (Although MeshPartHeadsAndAccessories also need to be enabled for the experience).
Indicates whether characters spawning into an experience will have layered clothing accessories equipped on them.

@roblox/enum/ZIndexBehavior.Global.documentation: The ZIndex property overrides the default value computed from the depth in the hierarchy.

@roblox/enum/ZIndexBehavior.Sibling.documentation: The ZIndex property controls the order in which the GuiObject renders relative to its siblings.

@roblox/enum/ZIndexBehavior.documentation: Used by LayerCollector.ZIndexBehavior to control how the GuiObject.ZIndex property behaves for descendants.

@roblox/enum/DevTouchCameraMovementMode..documentation: The camera will move based on the player's settings.
Camera tracks the player but will not automatically rotate if the player walks left or right.
Camera tracks the player and automatically rotates if the player walks left or right.
The camera has a fixed Y position, but can be rotated around the player.

@roblox/enum/DevTouchCameraMovementMode.documentation: Overwrites the camera mode if the player is on a touch device.

@roblox/enum/WrapLayerDebugMode.None.documentation: This debug rendering mode does nothing. This is the default value.

@roblox/enum/WrapLayerDebugMode.BoundCag.documentation: This debug mode visualizes corresponding cage mesh vertices bound to an underlying WrapTarget. In order to find corresponding vertices between different cages, the Wrap Deformer algorithm uses UV matching. As long as your WrapLayer cage mesh share the same UV layout as WrapTarget, its vertices will be marked as "bound".

@roblox/enum/WrapLayerDebugMode.LayerCag.documentation: This debug mode shows the resulting layer mesh as a whole. The deformer will use vertex locations from the previous layer for all unbound vertices.

@roblox/enum/WrapLayerDebugMode.BoundCag.documentation: The same as BoundCage but also visualizes how bound vertices were moved. You can use this mode to identify where they belong on a previous layer and where they are located on the current layer.

@roblox/enum/WrapLayerDebugMode.Referenc.documentation: This debug mode shows the original inner cage mesh as it was created.

@roblox/enum/WrapLayerDebugMode.Rbf.documentation: This debug mode visualizes the internal RBF solver state. You can estimate the wrap deformer's expected behavior by looking at this state. All renderable mesh vertices move from a "big sphere" to a "small sphere" along a corresponding line connecting two spheres.

@roblox/enum/WrapLayerDebugMode.OuterCag.documentation: This debug mode shows the original outer cage mesh as it was created.

@roblox/enum/WrapLayerDebugMode.documentation: The Studio-only property for quickly visualizing and debugging meshes with inner cage and outer cages.

@roblox/enum/WaterForce.documentation: The WaterForce Enum is used to work with Terrain water cells.

@roblox/enum/BorderMode.Outline.documentation: As GuiObject.BorderSizePixel increases, the border grows outward. The dimensions of the GuiObject's contents do not change.

@roblox/enum/BorderMode.Middle.documentation: As GuiObject.BorderSizePixel increases, the border grows evenly inward and outward. The dimensions of the GuiObject's contents are reduced at a 1:1 ratio.

@roblox/enum/BorderMode.Inset.documentation: As GuiObject.BorderSizePixel increases, the border grows evenly inward only. The dimensions of the GuiObject's contents are reduced at a 1:2 ratio.

@roblox/enum/BorderMode.documentation: Used by GuiObject.BorderMode to determine where borders are placed.

@roblox/enum/ParticleFlipbookLayout.None.documentation: Disable flipbook features and use the texture as a single static texture over the particle's lifetime.

@roblox/enum/ParticleFlipbookLayout.documentation: Determines the layout of the flipbook texture.

@roblox/enum/DevTouchMovementMode.UserCh.documentation: The player's character will moved based on the user's settings.

@roblox/enum/DevTouchMovementMode.Thumbs.documentation: This item is deprecated. Use DynamicThumbstick for virtual thumbstick applications.

@roblox/enum/DevTouchMovementMode.DPad.documentation: This item is deprecated. Use DynamicThumbstick for virtual DPad applications.

@roblox/enum/DevTouchMovementMode.Thumbp.documentation: This item is deprecated. Use DynamicThumbstick for virtual thumbpad applications.

@roblox/enum/DevTouchMovementMode.ClickT.documentation: The player's character will attempt to move to a location in the world when the player taps a location.

@roblox/enum/DevTouchMovementMode.Script.documentation: The player will not respond to default controls; any character movement must be defined in custom scripts.

@roblox/enum/DevTouchMovementMode.Dynami.documentation: The player's character is controlled with a virtual thumbstick that appears when they touch the lower portion of the screen. Jumping is controlled with a separate button. Good for portrait mode and one handed play.

@roblox/enum/DevTouchMovementMode.documentation: Overrides the movement mode of players who are playing on touch devices.

@roblox/enum/DominantAxis.documentation: Used by UIAspectRatioConstraint.DominantAxis for resizing the object to maintain the aspect ratio.

@roblox/enum/CompletionItemTag.Deprecate.documentation: Indicates that the completion is deprecated, applying a penalty towards its score and crossing it out in the completion list.

@roblox/enum/CompletionItemTag.Incorrect.documentation: Indicates that the completion is a member and being accessed with the wrong index type (e.g. using : to access a property), hiding it from the completion list.

@roblox/enum/CompletionItemTag.PluginPer.documentation: Indicates that the completion requires Plugin security level to access, hiding it if the client lacks this level.

@roblox/enum/CompletionItemTag.CommandLi.documentation: Indicates that the completion requires Command line security level to access, hiding it if the client lacks this level.

@roblox/enum/CompletionItemTag.RobloxPer.documentation: Indicates that the completion requires Core Script security level to access, hiding it if the client lacks this level.

@roblox/enum/CompletionItemTag.AddParens.documentation: Instructs the editor to add parentheses before the cursor after inserting the given completion, if accepted.

@roblox/enum/CompletionItemTag.PutCursor.documentation: Instructs the editor to add parentheses before the cursor and move the cursor into the parentheses after inserting the given completion, if accepted.

@roblox/enum/CompletionItemTag.TypeCorre.documentation: Indicates that the completion is type correct in the current context, granting a bonus to its score.

@roblox/enum/CompletionItemTag.ClientSer.documentation: Indicates that the completion is being accessed from the wrong side of the client/server boundary (e.g. Players.LocalPlayer in a server script), hiding it from the completion list.

@roblox/enum/CompletionItemTag.documentation: Determines the tags for completion items in ScriptEditorService:RegisterAutocompleteCallback().

@roblox/enum/VerticalAlignment.documentation: Determines how grid is placed within it's parent's container in the y direction.

@roblox/enum/TextureMode.Stretch.documentation: For a Trail, the texture will stretch out based on the lifetime of the trail, and shrink inwards if the trail's attachments stop moving. For a Beam, the texture will repeat TextureLength times across the beam's overall length. See here for details.

@roblox/enum/TextureMode.Wrap.documentation: For a Trail, the texture will be tiled as the length of the trail changes, but the textures will remain stationary relative to their attachments. For a Beam, the texture repetitions will equal the beam's overall length (in studs) divided by its TextureLength. See here for details.

@roblox/enum/TextureMode.Static.documentation: For a Trail, the texture will be rolled out as the attachments move, and they will remain in place until their lifetime is met. This setting is ideal for trail textures that should appear "stamped" where rendered, such as paw prints or tire tracks. This value is not supported for Beam and therefore behaves identically to Wrap.

@roblox/enum/TextureMode.documentation: Describes how the texture of a Trail or Beam behaves.

@roblox/enum/ScaleType.Stretch.documentation: The image is stretched to fit within the element.

@roblox/enum/ScaleType.Slice.documentation: 9-Slice scaling: slice the image into 9 regions and apply different scaling rules to each region. The slice boundaries are determined by ImageLabel.SliceCenter or ImageButton.SliceCenter. See UI 9-Slice Design for more information. .

@roblox/enum/ScaleType.Tile.documentation: The image is tiled to fit within the element. For example, if the element is twice the X dimension of the image, the image will appear twice (2 tiles).

@roblox/enum/ScaleType.Fit.documentation: The image is scaled fit within the element X or Y dimension (whichever fits first).

@roblox/enum/ScaleType.Crop.documentation: The image is cropped to fit within the element.

@roblox/enum/ScaleType.documentation: Determines how an image (of a ImageLabel or ImageButton) is scaled.

@roblox/enum/WaterDirection.documentation: This Enum was once used to set the direction of Terrain water.

@roblox/enum/AccessoryType.Unknown.documentation: If the accessory type is not known.

@roblox/enum/AccessoryType.Hat.documentation: A hat accessory (may be a rigid or layered accessory).

@roblox/enum/AccessoryType.Hair.documentation: A hair accessory (may be a rigid or layered accessory).

@roblox/enum/AccessoryType.Face.documentation: A face accessory (may be a rigid or layered accessory).

@roblox/enum/AccessoryType.Neck.documentation: A neck Accessory (may be a rigid or layered accessory).

@roblox/enum/AccessoryType.Shoulder.documentation: A shoulder accessory (may be a rigid or layered accessory).

@roblox/enum/AccessoryType.Front.documentation: A front accessory (may be a rigid or layered accessory).

@roblox/enum/AccessoryType.Back.documentation: A back accessory (may be a rigid or layered accessory).

@roblox/enum/AccessoryType.Waist.documentation: A waist accessory (may be a rigid or layered accessory).

@roblox/enum/AccessoryType.LeftShoe.documentation: A layered clothing left shoe accessory.

@roblox/enum/AccessoryType.RightShoe.documentation: A layered clothing right shoe accessory.

@roblox/enum/AccessoryType.DressSkirt.documentation: A layered clothing dress or skirt accessory.

@roblox/enum/AccessoryType.documentation: A subset of AssetTypes which are relevant to only accessories.

@roblox/enum/NameOcclusion.NoOcclusion.documentation: Do not occlude (hide) any humanoid names.

@roblox/enum/NameOcclusion.documentation: The NameOcclusion Enum is used to set the Humanoid.NameOcclusion property.

@roblox/enum/OverrideMouseIconBehavior.N.documentation: The mouse icon behavior is not overridden - default behavior is used.

@roblox/enum/OverrideMouseIconBehavior.F.documentation: The mouse icon is forced to always remain shown/visible.
The mouse icon is forced to always remain hidden/invisible.

@roblox/enum/OverrideMouseIconBehavior.documentation: Overrides the behavior of the mouse icon to either force that it is always shown or force that it is always hidden.

@roblox/enum/LeftRight.Left.documentation: The object is on the left side of it's parent (x-axis).

@roblox/enum/LeftRight.Center.documentation: The object is centered on the center of it's parent (x-axis), expanding equally to the left and right of the parent's center.

@roblox/enum/LeftRight.Right.documentation: The object is on the right side of it's parent (x-axis).

@roblox/enum/LeftRight.documentation: The LeftRight Enum is used to set where the object is on the side of its parent.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidDisplayDistanceType.documentation: A player selecting Viewer on their Humanoid will see the Name and healthbar of other players if those other players are within the distance settings set in the Humanoid selecting Viewer (this can be thought of as the lowest priority, and will not be taken into account if other players are selecting 'Subject' or 'None').

A player selecting Subject on their Humanoid will allow other players to see their Name and healthbar if those other players are within the distance settings set in the Humanoid selecting Subject (this can be thought of as the second highest priority).
A player selecting None on their Humanoid will not have their Name and healthbar displayed to other players under any circumstance (this can be thought of as the highest priority).
HumanoidDisplayDistanceType determines how Humanoid.HealthDisplayDistance, and Humanoid.NameDisplayDistance are used in determining whether a players's name and health are visible to other players.

@roblox/enum/PositionAlignmentMode.documentation: The PositionAlignmentMode Enum is used to select the number of Attachments used in an alignment.

@roblox/enum/PartType.Cylinder.documentation: A cylinder shape oriented along the X axis.

@roblox/enum/PartType.Wedge.documentation: A wedge shape with a slope on one side.

@roblox/enum/PartType.CornerWedge.documentation: A wedge shape with slopes on two sides.

@roblox/enum/AnalyticsProgressionStatus..documentation: Default status. Used for an undefined status.

@roblox/enum/AnalyticsProgressionStatus.documentation: This enum is used as an argument in AnalyticsService:FirePlayerProgressionEvent() to describe the status of progression.

@roblox/enum/Platform.Windows.documentation: The client is running on a Windows Operating System.

@roblox/enum/Platform.OSX.documentation: The client is running on OSX (Apple desktop).

@roblox/enum/Platform.IOS.documentation: The client is running on IOS (Apple mobile).

@roblox/enum/Platform.Android.documentation: The client is running on Android (Google mobile).

@roblox/enum/Platform.XBoxOne.documentation: The client is running on an XBox One (console).

@roblox/enum/Platform.PS4.documentation: The client is running on a PS4 (console).

@roblox/enum/Platform.PS3.documentation: The client is running on a PS3 (console).

@roblox/enum/Platform.XBox360.documentation: The client is running on an XBox 360 (console).

@roblox/enum/Platform.WiiU.documentation: The client is running on a Wii U (console).

@roblox/enum/Platform.NX.documentation: The client is running on an NX Operating System (Cisco Nexus).

@roblox/enum/Platform.Ouya.documentation: The client is running on an Ouya Operating System (Android-Based).

@roblox/enum/Platform.AndroidTV.documentation: The client is running on an Android TV.

@roblox/enum/Platform.Chromecast.documentation: The client is running on Chromecast.

@roblox/enum/Platform.Linux.documentation: The client is running on a Linux Operating System (desktop).

@roblox/enum/Platform.SteamOS.documentation: The client is running on Steam.

@roblox/enum/Platform.WebOS.documentation: The client is running on WebOS.

@roblox/enum/Platform.DOS.documentation: The client is running on DOS.

@roblox/enum/Platform.BeOS.documentation: The client is running on BeOS.

@roblox/enum/Platform.UWP.documentation: The client is running on UWP.

@roblox/enum/Platform.None.documentation: The client's operating system is unknown.

@roblox/enum/Platform.documentation: Host operating system of the client.

@roblox/enum/SizeConstraint.RelativeXY.documentation: The scale of X and Y are independent.

@roblox/enum/SizeConstraint.RelativeXX.documentation: The scale of X is shared with Y.

@roblox/enum/SizeConstraint.RelativeYY.documentation: The scale of Y is shared with X.

@roblox/enum/SizeConstraint.documentation: Used to constrain the scale of a GUI object.

@roblox/enum/FormFactor.Symmetric.documentation: Increases by a rate of 1 along all axes.

@roblox/enum/FormFactor.Brick.documentation: Increases by a rate of 1 along the x- and z- axes, 1.2 along the y-axis.

@roblox/enum/FormFactor.Plate.documentation: Increases by a rate of 1 along the x- and z- axes, 0.4 along the y-axis.

@roblox/enum/FormFactor.Custom.documentation: Increases by a rate as low as .001 along all axes.

@roblox/enum/AlphaMode.Overlay.documentation: Overlays the SurfaceAppearance.ColorMap on top of the underlying part color based on the map's alpha channel.

@roblox/enum/AlphaMode.Transparency.documentation: Uses the ColorMap alpha channel to control the transparency of the surface. .

@roblox/enum/AlphaMode.documentation: Used by SurfaceAppearance.AlphaMode to determine how the alpha channel of the SurfaceAppearance.ColorMap of a SurfaceAppearance is used.

@roblox/enum/ScrollBarInset.None.documentation: The ScrollingFrame will never be insetted for this scrolling bar.

@roblox/enum/ScrollBarInset.ScrollBar.documentation: The ScrollingFrame will only be insetted if this scrollbar is being shown.

@roblox/enum/ScrollBarInset.Always.documentation: The ScrollingFrame will always be insetted regardless if the scrollbar is being shown or not.

@roblox/enum/ScrollBarInset.documentation: Indicates when the ScrollingFrame should be insetted by the space needed to show the scroll bar.

@roblox/enum/RaycastFilterType.Exclude.documentation: Every BasePart in the raycast operation will be considered except those that are descendants of objects in the filter list.

@roblox/enum/RaycastFilterType.Include.documentation: Only BaseParts which are descendants of objects in the filter list will be considered in the raycast operation.

@roblox/enum/RaycastFilterType.documentation: Used in a RaycastParams object to determine how its FilterDescendantsInstances list will be used.

@roblox/enum/ImageCombineType.BlendSourc.documentation: Blend pixels from the source with the pixels from the destination using source over alpha blending.

@roblox/enum/ImageCombineType.Overwrite.documentation: Overwrite all pixels in the destination image with the pixels from the source image.

@roblox/enum/ImageCombineType.documentation: An enum determining how two images should be combined together.

@roblox/enum/MeshPartHeadsAndAccessories.documentation: The default option to control the Workspace.MeshPartHeadsAndAccessories feature. This currently has the same meaning as "Enabled".

@roblox/enum/ScreenOrientation.Landscape.documentation: A preference where the game is displayed landscape (horizontally) with the bottom of the device on the left side of the screen.
A preference where the game is displayed landscape (horizontally) with the bottom of the device on the right side of the screen.

A preference where the game is displayed landscape (horizontally) with the bottom of the device on the left of right side of the screen depending on the device's orientation (the sensor determines which side allows for the game to be displayed right-side-up).

@roblox/enum/ScreenOrientation.Portrait.documentation: A preference where the game is displayed portrait (vertically) with the bottom of the device on the bottom of the screen.

@roblox/enum/ScreenOrientation.Sensor.documentation: A preference where the game is displayed depending on the best match to the device's current orientation - either landscape (left/right) or portrait.

@roblox/enum/ScreenOrientation.documentation: The preference of in-game screen orientation on hand-held devices.

@roblox/enum/AdornCullingMode.Automatic.documentation: Automatically culls adornment based on distance.

@roblox/enum/AdornCullingMode.Never.documentation: Never culls adornment. Adornment is always visible.

@roblox/enum/Style.BridgeStyleSupports.documentation: Truss beams contain bridge style supports.

@roblox/enum/Style.NoSupports.documentation: Truss beams do not contain supports.

@roblox/enum/Style.documentation: The Style Enum is used to set what style of supports the TrussPart has.

@roblox/enum/DataStoreRequestType.GetAsy.documentation: Refers to GetAsync() and the read of UpdateAsync().

@roblox/enum/DataStoreRequestType.SetInc.documentation: Refers to SetAsync(), IncrementAsync(), RemoveAsync(), and the write of UpdateAsync() when it returns a non-nil value.
Refers to SetAsync() and IncrementAsync() while using an OrderedDataStore.

@roblox/enum/DataStoreRequestType.documentation: Indicates the type of data store request being made.

@roblox/enum/DebuggerStatus.Timeout.documentation: Timed out while waiting for response.

@roblox/enum/DebuggerStatus.ConnectionLo.documentation: Connection to the debugger was lost.

@roblox/enum/DebuggerStatus.InvalidState.documentation: The request was not appropriate for the current debugger state.

@roblox/enum/DebuggerStatus.InvalidArgum.documentation: One of the request arguments was invalid.

@roblox/enum/DebuggerStatus.ConnectionCl.documentation: Connection closed while waiting for response.

@roblox/enum/AnalyticsLogLevel.Trace.documentation: Trace is the noisiest level, rarely (if ever) enabled for a production app.

@roblox/enum/AnalyticsLogLevel.Error.documentation: When functionality is unavailable or expectations broken.

@roblox/enum/AnalyticsLogLevel.Fatal.documentation: The most critical level, Fatal events demand immediate attention.

@roblox/enum/Technology.Legacy.documentation: Legacy lighting technology that is no longer available. Don't use.

@roblox/enum/Technology.Voxel.documentation: Uses a 4x4x4 voxel map for light and shadow calculation.

@roblox/enum/Technology.Compatibility.documentation: Simulates the deprecated legacy technology using the Voxel system. Not recommended.

@roblox/enum/Technology.ShadowMap.documentation: Features shadow mapping that produces more realistic and crisp shadows from sunlight or directional light sources.

@roblox/enum/Technology.Future.documentation: Features the most advanced technology for high-fidelity lighting and shadows.

@roblox/enum/Technology.documentation: The Technology enum represents the different lighting systems available for rendering the 3D world. It is used by the Lighting.Technology property.

@roblox/enum/RibbonTool.MaterialPicker.documentation: Deprecated in favor of Material Manager. Don't use.

@roblox/enum/VibrationMotor.LeftHand.documentation: Left hand motor for VR devices.

@roblox/enum/VibrationMotor.RightHand.documentation: Right hand motor for VR devices.

@roblox/enum/VibrationMotor.documentation: Describes various types of haptic motor sizes and locations.

@roblox/enum/GearGenreSetting.MatchingGe.documentation: Only gear genres matching the allowed genres specified in a place's configuration settings.

@roblox/enum/ActuatorRelativeTo.Attachme.documentation: The constraint is expressed relative to Attatchment0.
The constraint is expressed relative to Attatchment1.

@roblox/enum/ActuatorRelativeTo.World.documentation: The constraint is expressed relative to the game world.

@roblox/enum/ActuatorRelativeTo.documentation: The CFrame value in which the body mover constraint is expressed.

@roblox/enum/FilterResult.documentation: Used to determine the result of a text filter request.

@roblox/enum/RenderPriority.Last.documentation: This should run as last, after Character.

@roblox/enum/RenderPriority.documentation: A list of standard reserved values in BindToRenderStep.

@roblox/enum/UserCFrame.Head.documentation: The CFrame of the user's head.

@roblox/enum/UserCFrame.LeftHand.documentation: The CFrame of the user's left hand.

@roblox/enum/UserCFrame.RightHand.documentation: The CFrame of the user's right hand.

@roblox/enum/UserCFrame.documentation: Determines what body part is being tracked by a VR device, and what its CFrame actually is.

@roblox/enum/ConnectionState.documentation: Used to determine the connection state of the client to the game server.

@roblox/enum/MembershipType.None.documentation: The player does not have an active paid membership.

@roblox/enum/MembershipType.Premium.documentation: The player has an active Premium membership.

@roblox/enum/MembershipType.documentation: The membership type of a Player.

@roblox/enum/AnimatorRetargetingMode.Def.documentation: Retargeting in default state, opt-in initially but subject to change.

@roblox/enum/Genre.All.documentation: The game's genre is set to All. The game will be listed as all possible genres.

@roblox/enum/Genre.TownAndCity.documentation: The game's genre is set to Town and City.

@roblox/enum/Genre.Fantasy.documentation: The game's genre is set to Fantasy.

@roblox/enum/Genre.SciFi.documentation: The game's genre is set to SciFi (Science Fiction).

@roblox/enum/Genre.Ninja.documentation: The game's genre is set to Ninja.

@roblox/enum/Genre.Scary.documentation: The game's genre is set to Scary.

@roblox/enum/Genre.Pirate.documentation: The game's genre is set to Pirate.

@roblox/enum/Genre.Adventure.documentation: The game's genre is set to Adventure.

@roblox/enum/Genre.Sports.documentation: The game's genre is set to Sports.

@roblox/enum/Genre.Funny.documentation: The game's genre is set to Funny.

@roblox/enum/Genre.WildWest.documentation: The game's genre is set to Wild West.

@roblox/enum/Genre.War.documentation: The game's genre is set to War.

@roblox/enum/Genre.SkatePark.documentation: The game's genre is set to Skate Park.

@roblox/enum/Genre.Tutorial.documentation: The game's genre is set to Tutorial.

@roblox/enum/Genre.documentation: Used to represent the type of game.

@roblox/enum/PoseEasingDirection.In.documentation: The EasingStyle curve is reversed, with the easing becoming linear as it approaches the next keyframe.

@roblox/enum/PoseEasingDirection.Out.documentation: EasingStyle curves are applied in the forward direction, from the current keyframe to the next.

@roblox/enum/PoseEasingDirection.InOut.documentation: Two easing curves are applied back-to-back with the linear ends of the curves meeting in the middle.

@roblox/enum/PoseEasingDirection.documentation: Used exclusively by Pose.EasingDirection to specify direction of the EasingStyle curve.

@roblox/enum/AvatarPromptResult.Permissi.documentation: Denied permission to take the prompted action.

@roblox/enum/AvatarPromptResult.Failed.documentation: Failure while trying to take the prompted action.

@roblox/enum/AvatarPromptResult.documentation: The result of prompt operations of AvatarEditorService.

@roblox/enum/TeleportState.RequestedFrom.documentation: The server has requested that the client teleport.

@roblox/enum/TeleportState.Started.documentation: The client has started attempting to teleport.

@roblox/enum/TeleportState.WaitingForSer.documentation: The client is waiting for the server to respond to the teleport request.

@roblox/enum/TeleportState.InProgress.documentation: The teleport is currently in progress. The player usually disconnects and teleports to the destination after this.

@roblox/enum/TeleportState.documentation: Determines the current teleportation state of a player.

@roblox/enum/RigType.documentation: The type of rig being imported with the 3D Importer.

@roblox/enum/IKControlConstraintSupport..documentation: The default option for IKControls. The default is currently set to Enabled.
Disables support for constraints for IKControls. When disabled, IKControls still work, but ignore physics constraints.

@roblox/enum/IKControlConstraintSupport.documentation: Values for Workspace.IKControlConstraintSupport. Sets the support for constraints for IKControls in your experience.

@roblox/enum/HttpContentType.documentation: Specifies the value of the HTTP Content-Type header which describes the HTTP request data type.

@roblox/enum/AssetFetchStatus.Failure.documentation: The asset failed to load successfully. Subsequent attempts are likely the fail; there may be something wrong with the Content string.

@roblox/enum/AssetFetchStatus.None.documentation: The engine has no information about this asset. The engine never tried to load it.

@roblox/enum/AssetFetchStatus.Loading.documentation: The engine is in the middle of trying to load this asset.

@roblox/enum/AssetFetchStatus.TimedOut.documentation: The engine tried to load this asset but timed out. Future attempts to load may succeed.

@roblox/enum/BreakpointRemoveReason.Requ.documentation: Breakpoint removal was requested by user or a command.

@roblox/enum/BreakpointRemoveReason.Scri.documentation: Script that contained the breakpoint has changed.
Script that contained the breakpoint was removed.

@roblox/enum/BreakpointRemoveReason.documentation: Reason that a breakpoint was removed.

@roblox/enum/ListDisplayMode.documentation: Used to set the scrolling mode of the Advanced Objects tab.

@roblox/enum/FrameStyle.Custom.documentation: Uses the frame's GuiObject.BackgroundColor3, GuiObject.BorderColor3, and GuiObject.BackgroundTransparency properties to determine the frame's appearance. It has no padding; elements with the position {{0, 0}, {0, 0}} will appear at the frame's top-left corner.

@roblox/enum/FrameStyle.ChatBlue.documentation: Causes the frame to appear similar to a Dialog with its Dialog.Tone property set to DialogTone neutral. This has a padding of fifteen pixels on all sides.

@roblox/enum/FrameStyle.RobloxSquare.documentation: Causes the frame to appear as a translucent dark gray rectangle with a padding of five pixels on all sides.

@roblox/enum/FrameStyle.RobloxRound.documentation: Causes the frame to appear as a translucent dark gray rectangle with rounded edges. Like "RobloxSquare" this has a padding of five pixels on all sides.

@roblox/enum/FrameStyle.ChatGreen.documentation: Causes the frame to appear similar to a Dialog with its Tone property set to "Friendly." Like "ChatBlue" this has a padding of fifteen pixels on all sides.

@roblox/enum/FrameStyle.ChatRed.documentation: Causes the frame to appear similar to a Dialog with its Tone property set to "Enemy." Like "ChatBlue" and "ChatGreen" this has a padding of fifteen pixels on all sides.

@roblox/enum/FrameStyle.DropShadow.documentation: Causes the frame to appear as a translucent gray rectangle with blurred sides. The blur is more apparent on the bottom edge. It has a padding of eight pixels on all sides.

@roblox/enum/ControlMode.Classic.documentation: Allows the camera to be moved by clicking and dragging with the right mouse button.

@roblox/enum/ControlMode.MouseLockSwitch.documentation: Similar to classic, but allows the player to toggle mouse locking, causing the camera to rotate as the player moves the mouse (without holding down a button).

@roblox/enum/ControlMode.documentation: The ControlMode Enum sets how the player is controlled.

@roblox/enum/TextXAlignment.Left.documentation: Alignment starts at the left side of the GUI object.

@roblox/enum/TextXAlignment.Right.documentation: Alignment starts at the right side of the GUI object.

@roblox/enum/TextXAlignment.Center.documentation: Aligned starts at the center of the GUI object and spreads equally left and right.

@roblox/enum/DevComputerMovementMode.Use.documentation: The player's character will moved based on the user's settings.

@roblox/enum/DevComputerMovementMode.Key.documentation: The player's character will be controlled using the keyboard and mouse.

@roblox/enum/DevComputerMovementMode.Cli.documentation: The player can right click in the game world and the character will move there. Player can also control character with mouse and keyboard.

@roblox/enum/DevComputerMovementMode.Scr.documentation: The player will not respond to default controls. You must define any character movement in custom scripts.

@roblox/enum/DevComputerMovementMode.documentation: Sets the movement mode of players who are playing on computers.

@roblox/enum/SortOrder.Name.documentation: Elements will be ordered by their Instance.Name in alphabetical order (e.g. Apple will be placed before Banana).

@roblox/enum/SortOrder.Custom.documentation: Deprecated. Elements are ordered by the function passed to UIGridStyleLayout:SetCustomSortFunction().

@roblox/enum/SortOrder.LayoutOrder.documentation: Elements will be ordered by GuiObject.LayoutOrder in ascending order (e.g. 0 will be placed before 1).

@roblox/enum/SortOrder.documentation: Used by UIGridStyleLayout.SortOrder to order the elements in the layout.

@roblox/enum/TextTruncate.AtEnd.documentation: Text is truncated at the end of the text, extra graphemes that cannot fit into the space are replaced with '...'.

@roblox/enum/TextTruncate.documentation: Controls the truncation of text when using the TextTruncate property.

@roblox/enum/CameraType.Attach.documentation: Camera moves with the subject at a fixed offset and will rotate as the subject rotates.

@roblox/enum/CameraType.Watch.documentation: Camera is stationary but will rotate to keep the subject in the center of the screen.

@roblox/enum/CameraType.Track.documentation: Camera moves with the subject but does not rotate automatically.

@roblox/enum/CameraType.Follow.documentation: Camera moves with the subject and rotates to keep the subject in the center.

@roblox/enum/CameraType.Custom.documentation: Default mode used by Roblox Core Scripts.

@roblox/enum/CameraType.Scriptable.documentation: No default behavior. Used when developers need to script custom behavior.

@roblox/enum/CameraType.Orbital.documentation: The camera has a fixed Y position, but can be rotated around the player.

@roblox/enum/CameraType.documentation: Describes the camera behavior mode if using the default PlayerScripts.

@roblox/enum/OrientationAlignmentMode.documentation: The OrientationAlignmentMode Enum is used to select the number of Attachments used in an alignment.

@roblox/enum/WeldConstraintPreserve.All.documentation: All WeldConstraints will be returned in the recommended table.

@roblox/enum/WeldConstraintPreserve.None.documentation: WeldConstraints will be ignored and not returned in the recommended table.

@roblox/enum/WeldConstraintPreserve.Touc.documentation: Only WeldConstraints that connect touching parts in the performed operation will be returned in the recommended table.

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.MainB.documentation: The primary background color used by the ribbon bar and windows.

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.Title.documentation: The color of windows' title bars.

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.Dropd.documentation: The color of dropdown menus, like those found in the Properties window.

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.Toolt.documentation: The background color of tooltips, like those seen when hovering over buttons on the ribbon bar or properties in the Properties window.

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.Scrol.documentation: The color of scrollbar handles, like those seen in the Explorer window.
The background color of scrollbars, like those seen in the Explorer window.

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.TabBa.documentation: The background color of the tab bar, like the one where the script editor is opened.

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.Tab.documentation: The color of tabs on the tab bar, like the ones opened when the script editor is opened.

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.Ribbo.documentation: The color of a tab on the ribbon menu (e.g. Home, Model, Test).
The background color of the ribbon menu.

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.Butto.documentation: The background color of clickable buttons.

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.MainB.documentation: The background color of clickable buttons that are the primary action.

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.Ribbo.documentation: The background color of buttons on the ribbon menu.

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.ViewP.documentation: The background color of the game viewport.

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.Input.documentation: The background color of input fields, like those found in the Explorer window.

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.GameS.documentation: The color of items within tables in the game settings window.
The color of tooltips in the game settings window.

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.Emula.documentation: The color of the bar shown when the mobile emulator is active.
The color of the device and physical size dropdowns in the emulator bar.

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.Color.documentation: The background color of the color picker.

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.Borde.documentation: The color of borders, like those found in the Properties window.

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.Shado.documentation: The color of shadows rendered under floating items like dropdowns.

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.Statu.documentation: The color of the status bar shown at the bottom of Studio, if it is visible.

@roblox/enum/CollisionFidelity.Default.documentation: Collision model uses a voxel-based convex-hull decomposition that is relatively fast but may not be highly accurate, especially for holes, doorways, and cavities in general.

@roblox/enum/CollisionFidelity.Hull.documentation: Collision model uses the convex hull of the visual mesh.

@roblox/enum/CollisionFidelity.Box.documentation: Collision model uses a bounding box that encompasses the visual mesh.

@roblox/enum/CollisionFidelity.PreciseCo.documentation: Collison model uses a convex-hull decomposition of the visual mesh which is computed by a variation of an algorithm called HACD. This option is the most accurate representation of collision geometry for complex objects with built-in tolerances to reduce the total number of convex-hulls by compromising on accuracy when justified.

@roblox/enum/CollisionFidelity.documentation: Determines behavior of the collision hitbox for MeshPart and PartOperation instances.

@roblox/enum/TickCountSampleMethod.Fast.documentation: Compute time using a faster, but less precise method.

@roblox/enum/TickCountSampleMethod.Bench.documentation: Dynamically decide between using ''Fast'' and ''Precise'' depending on performance.

@roblox/enum/TickCountSampleMethod.Preci.documentation: Compute time using a precise method.

@roblox/enum/TickCountSampleMethod.documentation: Controls the precision of a timer.

@roblox/enum/FillDirection.Horizontal.documentation: Fill in the left to right direction.

@roblox/enum/FillDirection.Vertical.documentation: Fill in the top to bottom direction.

@roblox/enum/FillDirection.documentation: Used by UIGridStyleLayout.FillDirection to control which direction elements are placed.

@roblox/enum/StreamOutBehavior.Default.documentation: Currently equivalent to LowMemory. This will eventually change to Opportunistic.

@roblox/enum/StreamOutBehavior.LowMemory.documentation: Only stream out when memory is low.

@roblox/enum/StreamOutBehavior.Opportuni.documentation: Stream out content that is significantly outside of the current StreamingRadius.

@roblox/enum/StreamOutBehavior.documentation: Determines how content is streamed away from Players.

@roblox/enum/CreatorType.User.documentation: The place is owned by a single user.

@roblox/enum/CreatorType.Group.documentation: The place is owned by a group.

@roblox/enum/ClientAnimatorThrottlingMod.documentation: The default animation throttling mode defined by Roblox.
An Enum describing various animation throttling modes on clients.

@roblox/enum/ResamplerMode.Default.documentation: Bilinear filtering of the four near pixels in the image.

@roblox/enum/ResamplerMode.Pixelated.documentation: Nearest neighbor filtering of the closest pixel in the image.

@roblox/enum/SurfaceConstraint.Hinge.documentation: Makes the side appear with a yellow hinge. Any part connected to this hinge will stick to the side and rotate using physics.

@roblox/enum/SurfaceConstraint.SteppingM.documentation: Functions identically to a motor. It may have functioned differently in the past, but that functionality no longer seems to exist.

@roblox/enum/SurfaceConstraint.Motor.documentation: Acts the same as a Hinge, but has a grey ring around it and automatically rotates any part connected to it.

@roblox/enum/SurfaceConstraint.documentation: This item is deprecated and is replaced by the SurfaceType enum.

@roblox/enum/DeveloperMemoryTag.Internal.documentation: General data that doesn't have any categorization. This could be due to either internal reasons, or because it simply isn't being tracked categorically.

@roblox/enum/DeveloperMemoryTag.Instance.documentation: All the Instances present in memory.

@roblox/enum/DeveloperMemoryTag.LuaHeap.documentation: All of the data in Lua. this includes everything happening in CoreScripts, the built-in data types, etc.

@roblox/enum/DeveloperMemoryTag.Script.documentation: All memory being manipulated and referenced by scripts.

@roblox/enum/DeveloperMemoryTag.PhysicsP.documentation: Physics bodies and the components that control their behavior.

@roblox/enum/DeveloperMemoryTag.Graphics.documentation: Rendering solid models (stuff made with Union, Negate, etc.).
Spatial hash lookup tables of the game world that are used for rendering.
Rendering of textures in the game world.
Rendering of texture composition maps that are generated for Humanoids.

@roblox/enum/DeveloperMemoryTag.Animatio.documentation: Playback of Animations on Humanoids and AnimationControllers.

@roblox/enum/DeveloperMemoryTag.Navigati.documentation: Pathfinding for Humanoids via the PathfindingService.

@roblox/enum/UiMessageType.documentation: Controls the UI message under the GuiService.

@roblox/enum/PlaybackState.Begin.documentation: The tween has been created, but has yet to be played. After exiting this state, the tween never enters it again.

@roblox/enum/PlaybackState.Delayed.documentation: The tween is waiting for the duration specified in its TweenInfo.DelayTime. After the delay elapses, the tween plays.

@roblox/enum/PlaybackState.Playing.documentation: The tween is currently in progress.

@roblox/enum/PlaybackState.Paused.documentation: The tween is paused in the middle of playing.

@roblox/enum/PlaybackState.Cancelled.documentation: The tween was cancelled before completion.

@roblox/enum/PlaybackState.documentation: Describes the current state of a Tween in its Tween.PlaybackState property.

@roblox/enum/SaveFilter.SaveAll.documentation: Saves all data, including both world and game-related information.

@roblox/enum/SaveFilter.documentation: Used by DataModel.SavePlace to determine the type of save operation This enum determines which aspects of the current place are saved, based on the following options.

@roblox/enum/ChatPrivacyMode.AllUsers.documentation: A player can chat with all users in a game.

@roblox/enum/ChatPrivacyMode.NoOne.documentation: A player cannot chat with any other users in a game.

@roblox/enum/ChatPrivacyMode.Friends.documentation: A player can only chat with users in a game that are on their friends list.

@roblox/enum/SelfViewPosition.LastPositi.documentation: The position of the self view when it was last closed.

@roblox/enum/SelfViewPosition.TopLeft.documentation: Top-left corner of the screen, with slight padding from the top and left edges.

@roblox/enum/SelfViewPosition.TopRight.documentation: Top-right corner of the screen, with slight padding from the top and right edges.

@roblox/enum/SelfViewPosition.BottomLeft.documentation: Bottom-left corner of the screen, with slight padding from the bottom and left edges.

@roblox/enum/SelfViewPosition.BottomRigh.documentation: Bottom-right corner of the screen, with slight padding from the bottom and right edges.

@roblox/enum/SelfViewPosition.documentation: Defines the screen location of the current player's self view.

@roblox/enum/RunContext.Legacy.documentation: Runs in legacy script containers dependent on the type of script uses such as LocalScript or Script.

@roblox/enum/RunContext.Plugin.documentation: Runs as a descendant of Plugin instances.

@roblox/enum/PathStatus.ClosestNoPath.documentation: Path doesn't exist, returns path to closest point.

@roblox/enum/PathStatus.ClosestOutOfRang.documentation: Goal is out of MaxDistance range, returns path to closest point you can reach within MaxDistance.

@roblox/enum/PathStatus.FailStartNotEmpt.documentation: Failed to compute path; the starting point is not empty.

@roblox/enum/PathStatus.FailFinishNotEmp.documentation: Failed to compute path; the finish point is not empty.

@roblox/enum/PathStatus.documentation: The success of a Path generated by PathfindingService.

@roblox/enum/EasingStyle.Sine.documentation: Speed is determined by a sine wave.

@roblox/enum/EasingStyle.Back.documentation: Slightly overshoots the target, then backs into place.

@roblox/enum/EasingStyle.Quad.documentation: Speed is determined by quadratic interpolation.

@roblox/enum/EasingStyle.Quart.documentation: Similar to Quad, but starts at a higher speed determined by quartic interpolation.

@roblox/enum/EasingStyle.Quint.documentation: Similar to Quart, but starts at a higher speed determined by quintic interpolation.

@roblox/enum/EasingStyle.Bounce.documentation: Bounces backwards multiple times after reaching the target, before eventually settling.

@roblox/enum/EasingStyle.Elastic.documentation: Moves as if attached to a rubber band, overshooting the target several times.

@roblox/enum/EasingStyle.Exponential.documentation: Speed reduces very quickly as tween approaches the target.

@roblox/enum/EasingStyle.Circular.documentation: Follows a circular arc, slowing down as tween approaches the target.

@roblox/enum/EasingStyle.Cubic.documentation: Similar to Quad, but starts at a lower speed.

@roblox/enum/EasingStyle.documentation: Pass to TweenInfo.new to control the motion of a Tween.

@roblox/enum/PathWaypointAction.Walk.documentation: Walk action needed to reach the next waypoint.

@roblox/enum/PathWaypointAction.Jump.documentation: Jump action needed to reach the next waypoint.

@roblox/enum/PathWaypointAction.documentation: Describes the action to take when a PathWaypoint is reached.

@roblox/enum/CameraPanMode.Classic.documentation: Enables swipe and pan on mobile devices, and disables edge bump camera controls. Default.

@roblox/enum/CameraPanMode.EdgeBump.documentation: Disables swipe to pan on mobile devices, and enables edge bump camera controls. It does not affect Windows or Mac users.

@roblox/enum/CameraPanMode.documentation: The CameraPanMode Enum represents the available pan modes for Camera:SetCameraPanMode().

@roblox/enum/AspectType.FitWithinMaxSize.documentation: Makes the element the maximum size it can be within the current possible AbsoluteSize of the element while maintaining the aspect ratio.

@roblox/enum/AspectType.ScaleWithParentS.documentation: Scales the element to the largest size it can fit inside the parent element's maximum size whilse maintaining the aspect ratio.

@roblox/enum/AspectType.documentation: Used by UIAspectRatioConstraint.AspectType to control the sizing behavior.

@roblox/enum/GameAvatarType.PlayerChoice.documentation: The rig (either R6 or R15) determined by a player's character settings set on the website in the 'Edit Avatar' page.

@roblox/enum/GameAvatarType.documentation: Value indicating which type of avatar an experience uses.

@roblox/enum/BreakReason.Other.documentation: Pausing for a reason not covered by other values, for example if the user hit "Pause" button.

@roblox/enum/BreakReason.Error.documentation: Pausing on error hit in the code.

@roblox/enum/BreakReason.SpecialBreakpoi.documentation: Pausing on an internal breakpoint set by debugger command: e.g. step over, step into, step out of.

@roblox/enum/PermissionLevelShown.Game.documentation: Member must have no security permissions in order to be shown.

@roblox/enum/PermissionLevelShown.Roblox.documentation: Member must have security permissions less than or equal to RobloxPlaceSecurity to be shown.
Member must have security permissions less than or equal to RobloxScriptSecurity to be shown.

@roblox/enum/PermissionLevelShown.Studio.documentation: Member must have security permissions less than or equal to LocalUserSecurity to be shown.

@roblox/enum/PermissionLevelShown.Roblox.documentation: Member is shown no matter what security it has.

@roblox/enum/PermissionLevelShown.documentation: Used to set the highest permission level that APIs have to have in order to be shown in the Object Browser.

@roblox/enum/ChatStyle.Classic.documentation: Displays chats in the chat user interface at the top-left corner of the screen.

@roblox/enum/ChatStyle.Bubble.documentation: Displays chats in a bubble above the sender's head.

@roblox/enum/ChatStyle.ClassicAndBubble.documentation: Has the effects of Classic and Bubble combined.

@roblox/enum/ChatStyle.documentation: The ChatStyle Enum is used to set the style of Chat used in a game via the Players:SetChatStyle() method.

@roblox/enum/PackagePermission.None.documentation: Permission data is not available for the current user or group roleset.

@roblox/enum/PackagePermission.NoAccess.documentation: The current user or group roleset doesn't have access.

@roblox/enum/PackagePermission.Revoked.documentation: The current user's or group roleset's permission is revoked.

@roblox/enum/PackagePermission.UseView.documentation: The current user or group roleset can download a copy of the package from Roblox.

@roblox/enum/PackagePermission.Edit.documentation: The current user or group roleset can download a copy of the package from Roblox and publish package changes to Roblox.

@roblox/enum/PackagePermission.Own.documentation: The current user or group roleset can download a copy of the page from Roblox, publish package changes to Roblox, and manage who has access to the package.

@roblox/enum/PackagePermission.documentation: Indicates the current user's or group roleset's permission to the package.

@roblox/enum/ThumbnailSize.Size48x48.documentation: Thumbnail resolution is 48 pixels x 48 pixels.

@roblox/enum/ThumbnailSize.Size180x180.documentation: Thumbnail resolution is 180 pixels x 180 pixels.

@roblox/enum/ThumbnailSize.Size420x420.documentation: Thumbnail resolution is 420 pixels x 420 pixels.

@roblox/enum/ThumbnailSize.Size60x60.documentation: Thumbnail resolution is 60 pixels x 60 pixels.

@roblox/enum/ThumbnailSize.Size100x100.documentation: Thumbnail resolution is 100 pixels x 100 pixels.

@roblox/enum/ThumbnailSize.Size150x150.documentation: Thumbnail resolution is 150 pixels x 150 pixels.

@roblox/enum/ThumbnailSize.Size352x352.documentation: Thumbnail resolution is 352 pixels x 352 pixels.

@roblox/enum/PhysicsSteppingMethod.Fixed.documentation: All simulated assemblies inside the workspace will advance forward at 240 Hz. This option is best for optimal stability and simulation accuracy.

@roblox/enum/PhysicsSteppingMethod.Adapt.documentation: The engine attempts to assign optimal simulation rates for individual assemblies of either 240 Hz, 120 Hz, or 60 Hz. This setting is optimized for performance.

@roblox/enum/IKControlType.Transform.documentation: It is a full 6-DoF constraint. Aligns the EndEffector CFrame to that of the Target. It is the default value.

@roblox/enum/IKControlType.Position.documentation: Aligns the EndEffector position to that of the Target .

@roblox/enum/IKControlType.Rotation.documentation: Aligns the EndEffector rotation to that of the Target.

@roblox/enum/IKControlType.LookAt.documentation: Moves and orients the whole chain to make the forward axis on the EndEffector point at a position in the world specified by Target.

@roblox/enum/IKControlType.documentation: Used on IKControl to specify their Type, to change their behavior.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.NoReverb.documentation: No sound reverb. Audio is not changed from default.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.GenericReverb.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to a generic reverb effect.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.PaddedCell.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in a padded cell.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.Room.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in a room.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.Bathroom.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in a bathroom.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.LivingRoom.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in a living room.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.StoneRoom.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in a stone room.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.Auditorium.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in an auditorium.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.ConcertHall.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in a concert hall.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.Cave.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in a cave.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.Arena.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in an arena.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.Hangar.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in a hangar.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.CarpettedHallway.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in a carpeted hallway.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.Hallway.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in a hallway.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.StoneCorridor.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is a stone corridor.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.Alley.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in an alley.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.Forest.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in a forest.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.City.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in city.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.Mountains.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in the mountains.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.Quarry.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in a quarry.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.Plain.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is an open plain.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.ParkingLot.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in a parking lot.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.SewerPipe.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in a sewer pipe.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.UnderWater.documentation: Sound reverb makes it sound like the player is under water.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.documentation: The ReverbType Enum allows you to make audio in your game sound different, depending on what "area" the sounds are in.

@roblox/enum/TextYAlignment.Top.documentation: Alignment starts at the top of the GUI object.

@roblox/enum/TextYAlignment.Center.documentation: Aligned starts at the center of the GUI object and spreads equally toward the top and bottom.

@roblox/enum/TextYAlignment.Bottom.documentation: Alignment starts at the bottom of the GUI object.

@roblox/enum/UserInputState.Begin.documentation: Occurs when an InputObject starts to interact with the game. For example, a mouse button down, or a key down, or when a touch begins touching the screen.

@roblox/enum/UserInputState.Change.documentation: Occurs each frame an InputObject has already begun interacting with the game and part of its state is changing. For example, a movement of the mouse position, a gamepad thumbstick, gamepad trigger button, or screen touch point.

@roblox/enum/UserInputState.End.documentation: When an InputObject finishes interacting with the game. For example, a mouse button up, or a key up, or when a touch stops touching the screen.

@roblox/enum/UserInputState.Cancel.documentation: A special circumstance state that indicates this input is no longer relevant, particularly with ContextActionService. For example, binding two action-handling functions will cause the first to Cancel if an input was already in-progress when the second was bound.

@roblox/enum/UserInputState.None.documentation: A state that should never be seen in a game, essentially just marks the end of the enum.

@roblox/enum/UserInputState.documentation: The UserInputState enum describes the state of an input that is currently or was recently performed.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.Unknown.documentation: Blank value that represents no key being pressed.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.KeypadZero.documentation: The 0 key on the keypad cluster.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.KeypadOne.documentation: The 1 key on the keypad cluster.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.KeypadTwo.documentation: The 2 key on the keypad cluster.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.KeypadThree.documentation: The 3 key on the keypad cluster.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.KeypadFour.documentation: The 4 key on the keypad cluster.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.KeypadFive.documentation: The 5 key on the keypad cluster.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.KeypadSix.documentation: The 6 key on the keypad cluster.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.KeypadSeven.documentation: The 7 key on the keypad cluster.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.KeypadEight.documentation: The 8 key on the keypad cluster.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.KeypadNine.documentation: The 9 key on the keypad cluster.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.KeypadPeriod.documentation: The . key on the keypad cluster.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.KeypadDivide.documentation: The / key on the keypad cluster.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.KeypadMultiply.documentation: The * key on the keypad cluster.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.KeypadMinus.documentation: The - key on the keypad cluster.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.KeypadPlus.documentation: The + key on the keypad cluster.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.KeypadEnter.documentation: The Enter key on the keypad cluster.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.KeypadEquals.documentation: The = key on the keypad cluster.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.F13.documentation: The F13 key. Only present on certain keyboards.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.F14.documentation: The F14 key. Only present on certain keyboards.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.F15.documentation: The F15 key. Only present on certain keyboards.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.NumLock.documentation: The Num Lock key on the keypad cluster.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.LeftSuper.documentation: The left side Super key. Better known as the Windows key or Cmd key.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.RightSuper.documentation: The right side Super key. Better known as the Windows key or Cmd key.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.Euro.documentation: The € key. Only present on certain keyboards.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.DPadLeft.documentation: Left arrow on a gamepad D-pad.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.DPadRight.documentation: Right arrow on a gamepad D-pad.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.DPadUp.documentation: Up arrow on a gamepad D-pad.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.DPadDown.documentation: Down arrow on a gamepad D-pad.

@roblox/enum/KeyCode.documentation: A physical button that a user is pressing.

@roblox/enum/TeleportType.ToPlace.documentation: The teleport destination is a place (no specific instance).

@roblox/enum/TeleportType.ToInstance.documentation: The teleport destination is an instance of a place.

@roblox/enum/TeleportType.ToReservedServ.documentation: The destination of the teleport is a reserved server (a place instance that is reserved for a select group of players).

@roblox/enum/TeleportType.documentation: Determines the type of teleport destination for a TeleportService teleport call.

@roblox/enum/SurfaceType.Smooth.documentation: Makes the side appear without any surface detail (except for outlines).

@roblox/enum/SurfaceType.Glue.documentation: Makes the side appear with thick diagonal "X"s.

@roblox/enum/SurfaceType.Weld.documentation: Makes the side appear with thick diagonal "X"s.

@roblox/enum/SurfaceType.Studs.documentation: Makes the side appear with square studs.

@roblox/enum/SurfaceType.Inlet.documentation: Makes the side appear with holes where studs would be.

@roblox/enum/SurfaceType.Universal.documentation: Makes the side appear with both Studs and Inlets in a checker pattern.

@roblox/enum/SurfaceType.Hinge.documentation: Makes the side appear with a yellow hinge. Any part connected to this hinge will stick to the side and rotate using physics, however, using HingeConstraint to join parts is preferred.

@roblox/enum/SurfaceType.Motor.documentation: Acts the same as a Hinge, but has a grey ring around it and automatically rotates any part connected to it, however, using HingeConstraint to join parts is preferred.

@roblox/enum/SurfaceType.SteppingMotor.documentation: Functions identically to a motor. It may have functioned differently in the past, but that functionality no longer seems to exist.

@roblox/enum/SurfaceType.SmoothNoOutline.documentation: Same as Smooth, but removes the outlines of the surface.

@roblox/enum/SurfaceType.documentation: Used to determine how a surface should be displayed on a part and how automatic surface joints should behave.

@roblox/enum/Font.Unknown.documentation: Set when the TextLabel.FontFace property is set to a Font that has no corresponding enum value.

@roblox/enum/CoreGuiType.PlayerList.documentation: The CoreGui displaying the list of in-game players.

@roblox/enum/CoreGuiType.Health.documentation: The CoreGui displaying a player's health.

@roblox/enum/CoreGuiType.Backpack.documentation: The CoreGui displaying a player's backpack (containing a player's tools, gear, etc.).

@roblox/enum/CoreGuiType.Chat.documentation: The CoreGui used to display and send in-game chat message with other players.

@roblox/enum/CoreGuiType.EmotesMenu.documentation: Allows the Emotes Menu to be disabled using the existing StarterGui:SetCoreGuiEnabled() API. Disabling all CoreGui types using CoreGuiType.All would also disable the Emotes Menu.

@roblox/enum/CoreGuiType.documentation: The CoreGuiType Enum represents all CoreGui "types" which are available, such as the Backpack and Leaderboard.

@roblox/enum/DialogBehaviorType.SinglePl.documentation: Only one player can interact with this dialog at a time. The conversation between the player and dialog can be seen by all players.

@roblox/enum/DialogBehaviorType.Multiple.documentation: Multiple players can simultaneously interact with this dialog. The conversation between the player and the dialog cannot be seen by other players.

@roblox/enum/DialogBehaviorType.documentation: Controls whether multiple people can use this dialog, or only one person at a time can use it.

@roblox/enum/ApplyStrokeMode.Contextual.documentation: The stroke is applied to the parent UI element's text.

@roblox/enum/ApplyStrokeMode.Border.documentation: The stroke is applied to the parent UI element's border.

@roblox/enum/ApplyStrokeMode.documentation: Used by UIStroke.ApplyStrokeMode to determine where to apply the stroke.

@roblox/enum/TopBottom.Top.documentation: The object is above its parent.

@roblox/enum/TopBottom.Center.documentation: The object is centered around the center of its parent.

@roblox/enum/TopBottom.Bottom.documentation: The object is below its parent.

@roblox/enum/TopBottom.documentation: Sets where the object is on the side of its parent.

@roblox/enum/WrapTargetDebugMode.None.documentation: This debug rendering mode does nothing, and this is the default value.

@roblox/enum/WrapTargetDebugMode.TargetC.documentation: This debug mode shows the original cage mesh as it was created.
