This debug mode shows corresponding cage mesh compressed by clothing layers above it. This debug mode is intended to validate that the compression algorithm and corresponding cages work as intended.
This debug mode shows the resulting cage mesh for the corresponding Wrap Instance. This debug mode is intended to validate that the final deformed cage looks as intended.

@roblox/enum/WrapTargetDebugMode.TargetL.documentation: The same as TargetCageOriginal but affects all WrapTargets that belong to the Wrap Deformer simultaneously. It doesn't matter which particular WrapTarget you enable this debug visualization option.
The same as TargetCageCompressed but affects all WrapTargets that belong to the Wrap Deformer simultaneously. It doesn't matter which particular WrapTarget you enable this debug visualization option.
The same as TargetCageInterface but affects all WrapTargets that belong to the Wrap Deformer simultaneously. It doesn't matter which particular WrapTarget you enable this debug visualization option.

@roblox/enum/WrapTargetDebugMode.Rbf.documentation: This debug mode visualizes the internal RBF solver state. You can estimate the wrap deformer expected behavior by looking at this state. All renderable mesh vertices move from a "big sphere" to a "small sphere" along a corresponding line connecting two spheres.

@roblox/enum/WrapTargetDebugMode.documentation: The Studio-only property for quickly visualizing and debugging meshes with only outer cages.

@roblox/enum/InOut.Edge.documentation: The object is located along an edge of its parent.

@roblox/enum/InOut.Inset.documentation: The object's located is inset from its parent's location.

@roblox/enum/InOut.Center.documentation: The object's location is centered on it's parent.

@roblox/enum/InOut.documentation: The InOut Enum is used to set where the object is on the side of its parent.

@roblox/enum/PlayerChatType.All.documentation: A global message that everyone can receive.

@roblox/enum/PlayerChatType.Team.documentation: A team message only players in the same team can receive.

@roblox/enum/PlayerChatType.Whisper.documentation: A whispered message only the person it's whispered to can receive.

@roblox/enum/PlayerChatType.documentation: Determines the style of a chat message.

@roblox/enum/UserInputType.MouseMovement.documentation: Movement of the mouse. Fires changed events each time the player's cursor position changes and when the move enters/leaves the game window.

@roblox/enum/UserInputType.Touch.documentation: A tap on the screen from a mobile device.

@roblox/enum/UserInputType.Focus.documentation: The client regaining focus of the Roblox window.

@roblox/enum/UserInputType.Accelerometer.documentation: The accelerometer of a mobile device.

@roblox/enum/UserInputType.Gyro.documentation: The Gyroscope of a mobile device.

@roblox/enum/UserInputType.Gamepad1.documentation: Input from the 1st plugged in Gamepad.

@roblox/enum/UserInputType.Gamepad2.documentation: Input from the 2nd plugged in Gamepad.

@roblox/enum/UserInputType.Gamepad3.documentation: Input from the 3rd plugged in Gamepad.

@roblox/enum/UserInputType.Gamepad4.documentation: Input from the 4th plugged in Gamepad.

@roblox/enum/UserInputType.Gamepad5.documentation: Input from the 5th plugged in Gamepad.

@roblox/enum/UserInputType.Gamepad6.documentation: Input from the 6th plugged in Gamepad.

@roblox/enum/UserInputType.Gamepad7.documentation: Input from the 7th plugged in Gamepad.

@roblox/enum/UserInputType.Gamepad8.documentation: Input from the 8th plugged in Gamepad.

@roblox/enum/UserInputType.TextInput.documentation: Input of Text into a text-based GuiObject. Normally this is only a TextBox.

@roblox/enum/UserInputType.InputMethod.documentation: Text input from an input method editor (IME). InputObjects with this type aren't currently fired.

@roblox/enum/UserInputType.documentation: Describes the type of a user input event.

@roblox/enum/ChatMode.Menu.documentation: The player is restricted to chatting via a menu of chat messages.

@roblox/enum/ChatMode.TextAndMenu.documentation: A player can chat via custom text messages and a menu of chat messages.

@roblox/enum/TouchMovementMode.Thumbstic.documentation: Change the movement controller to the classic thumbstick.

@roblox/enum/TouchMovementMode.DPad.documentation: Change the movement controller to the DPad.

@roblox/enum/TouchMovementMode.Thumbpad.documentation: Change the movement controller to the thumbpad.

@roblox/enum/TouchMovementMode.ClickToMo.documentation: Change the movement controller to click to move.

@roblox/enum/TouchMovementMode.DynamicTh.documentation: Change the movement controller to the dynamic thumbstick.

@roblox/enum/TouchMovementMode.documentation: The movement mode used by a client with a TouchEnabled device.

@roblox/enum/LineJoinMode.Round.documentation: The corners are rounded (see image above).

@roblox/enum/LineJoinMode.Bevel.documentation: The corners are beveled (see image above).

@roblox/enum/LineJoinMode.Miter.documentation: The corners are mitered (see image above).

@roblox/enum/LineJoinMode.documentation: This enum is used by UIStroke.LineJoinMode to determine how corners are interpreted.

@roblox/enum/SelectionBehavior.Escape.documentation: Prioritizes GuiObjects within the same SelectionGroup but allows the selection to move to other outside GuiObjects if no suitable button is found.

@roblox/enum/SelectionBehavior.Stop.documentation: Constrains gamepad selection to the SelectionGroup.

@roblox/enum/SelectionBehavior.documentation: Customization options for gamepad selection when GuiBase2d.SelectionGroup is true.

@roblox/enum/ComputerMovementMode.Keyboa.documentation: The player's character is controlled using the keyboard and mouse.

@roblox/enum/ComputerMovementMode.ClickT.documentation: The player can right click in the game world and the character will move there. Player can also control character with mouse and keyboard.

@roblox/enum/ComputerMovementMode.documentation: The computer movement type in-use by the client.

@roblox/enum/InputType.NoInput.documentation: Behaves like a weld and does nothing.

@roblox/enum/InputType.Constant.documentation: Rotate at a constant velocity of BasePart ParamB.

@roblox/enum/InputType.Sin.documentation: Rotate at a velocity of: ParamA * math.sin(workspace.DistributedGameTime * ParamB), where BasePart ParamA determines the maximum speed at which the part spins, and BasePart ParamB determines how frequently it changes direction.

@roblox/enum/InputType.documentation: The InputType Enum controls the SurfaceInputs of Part.

@roblox/enum/FinishRecordingOperation.Ca.documentation: Cancels the recording, automatically undoing any work in progress.

@roblox/enum/FinishRecordingOperation.Ap.documentation: Commits the recorded work and merges with the previous recording if possible.

@roblox/enum/FluidFidelity.Automatic.documentation:
Let the physics engine select the geometric representation for aerodynamic force and torque calculations.
.

@roblox/enum/FluidFidelity.UseCollisionG.documentation: Use the current collision geometry specified by TriangleMeshPart.CollisionFidelity for aerodynamic force and torque calculations .

@roblox/enum/FluidFidelity.UsePreciseGeo.documentation: Force the engine to compute aerodynamic forces and torques using a more precise geometry representation based on the original mesh. This option may increase join and replication time if used on a large scale.

@roblox/enum/FluidFidelity.documentation: Determines the geometric representation used to compute aerodynamic forces.

@roblox/enum/BodyPartR15.documentation: BodyPartR15 is an enum with entries for each of the 15 body parts of an R15 character (plus an entry for the HumanoidRootPart).

@roblox/enum/Button.documentation: One of the buttons used by Controller.

@roblox/enum/ScrollingDirection.X.documentation: Canvas can only be scrolled along the X axis.

@roblox/enum/ScrollingDirection.Y.documentation: Canvas can only be scrolled along the Y axis.

@roblox/enum/ScrollingDirection.XY.documentation: Canvas can be scrolled along both X and Y axes.

@roblox/enum/ScrollingDirection.documentation: This enum is used by ScrollingFrame.ScrollingDirection to specify the direction scrolling is allowed.

@roblox/enum/ButtonStyle.Custom.documentation: The button will respect the GuiObject.BorderColor3 and GuiObject.BackgroundColor3 properties.

@roblox/enum/ButtonStyle.RobloxButtonDef.documentation: A black background with a red border, and rounded corners.

@roblox/enum/ButtonStyle.RobloxButton.documentation: A black background with a grey border, and rounded corners.

@roblox/enum/ButtonStyle.RobloxRoundButt.documentation: A grey background with rounded corners, and a slight drop shadow.

@roblox/enum/ButtonStyle.RobloxRoundDefa.documentation: A blue background with rounded corners, and a slight drop shadow.

@roblox/enum/ButtonStyle.RobloxRoundDrop.documentation: A white background with a thin grey border, rounded corners, and a slight drop shadow.

@roblox/enum/ButtonStyle.documentation: Used by GuiButton.Style to set a special hardcoded appearance.

@roblox/enum/ModelStreamingBehavior.Defa.documentation: Engine determines best behavior. Currently equivalent to Legacy.

@roblox/enum/ModelStreamingBehavior.Lega.documentation: Models are sent when their parent is sent, typically during player join. Models are never streamed out unless an ancestor of the model is streamed out.

@roblox/enum/ModelStreamingBehavior.Impr.documentation: Models are never sent during player join. Models that are "non-spatial" (containing no BasePart descendants) are sent soon after join, but before the Workspace.PersistentLoaded event fires. Models that are "spatial" (containing BasePart descendants) are sent when any BasePart descendant needs to be streamed to a client, and may stream out when all BasePart descendants are eligible to stream out.

@roblox/enum/ModelStreamingBehavior.documentation: Controls how Models are sent to clients in experiences with instance streaming enabled.

@roblox/enum/RotationOrder.documentation: The order of rotation axes used for Euler angles encoding of rotations.

@roblox/enum/InitialDockState.Top.documentation: The widget will appear docked above the game screen.

@roblox/enum/InitialDockState.Bottom.documentation: The widget will appear docked below the game screen.

@roblox/enum/InitialDockState.Left.documentation: The widget will appear docked to the left of the game screen.

@roblox/enum/InitialDockState.Right.documentation: The widget will appear docked to the right of the game screen.

@roblox/enum/InitialDockState.Float.documentation: The widget will not be docked to any side of the game screen, and instead can be freely dragged around.

@roblox/enum/InitialDockState.documentation: Describes the initial docking state of a DockWidgetPluginGui.

@roblox/enum/TextChatMessageStatus.Unkno.documentation: Generic failed status for any other TextChannel:SendAsync() failures.

@roblox/enum/TextChatMessageStatus.TextF.documentation: Text filter failed to process the message.

@roblox/enum/TextChatMessageStatus.Flood.documentation: Message is from a user sending messages too frequently.

@roblox/enum/TextChatMessageStatus.Inval.documentation: Message can't be sent because of the user's chat privacy settings.
Message's TextSource is either not in the intended TextChannel or TextSource.CanSend is false.

@roblox/enum/ThumbnailType.HeadShot.documentation: The returned thumbnail shows just the headshot (head and up) of the user's avatar.

@roblox/enum/ThumbnailType.AvatarBust.documentation: The returned thumbnail shows the bust (chest up) of the user's avatar.

@roblox/enum/ThumbnailType.AvatarThumbna.documentation: The returned thumbnail shows the entire body of the user's avatar.

@roblox/enum/VirtualCursorMode.Default.documentation: The Virtual Cursor is in the default state.

@roblox/enum/VirtualCursorMode.documentation: Enables Virtual Cursor mode within an experience.

@roblox/enum/ParticleFlipbookMode.Loop.documentation: Continuously play through all frames, starting back at the first frame after playing the last.

@roblox/enum/ParticleFlipbookMode.OneSho.documentation: Play through the animation only once across the particle's lifetime. With this setting, the ParticleEmitter.FlipbookFramerate property doesn't apply; instead, the framerate is determined by the particle's ParticleEmitter.Lifetime divided evenly by the number of frames in the animation. OneShot animations are useful for clear non-repeating animations, such as an explosion that creates a puff of smoke and then fades out.

@roblox/enum/ParticleFlipbookMode.PingPo.documentation: Play from the first to the last frame, then in reverse from the last to the first, repeating throughout the ParticleEmitter.Lifetime of the particle.

@roblox/enum/ParticleFlipbookMode.Random.documentation: Play the frames in a random order, blending/crossfading from one frame to the next. This can be useful for organic particle textures at low framerates, such as stars slowly twinkling between subtly different shapes.

@roblox/enum/ParticleFlipbookMode.documentation: Determines the type of the flipbook animation.

@roblox/enum/MoveState.Coasting.documentation: Skateboard is coasting (not actively speeding up / being pushed).

@roblox/enum/MoveState.Stopping.documentation: Skateboard is stopping, but still moving.

@roblox/enum/FriendRequestEvent.Issue.documentation: A player invokes (sends) a friend request.

@roblox/enum/FriendRequestEvent.Revoke.documentation: A player revokes (cancels) a previously invoked (sent) friend request.

@roblox/enum/FriendRequestEvent.Accept.documentation: A player accepts a friend request.

@roblox/enum/FriendRequestEvent.Deny.documentation: A player denies a friend request.

@roblox/enum/SwipeDirection.None.documentation: The user did not swipe in a certain direction.

@roblox/enum/SwipeDirection.documentation: The direction that a user is swiping on their touch screen.

@roblox/enum/RollOffMode.Inverse.documentation: Volume attenuates from Sound.RollOffMinDistance in an inverse manner.

@roblox/enum/RollOffMode.Linear.documentation: Volume attenuates between Sound.RollOffMinDistance and Sound.RollOffMaxDistance with a linear relationship.

@roblox/enum/RollOffMode.LinearSquare.documentation: Volume attenuates between Sound.RollOffMinDistance and Sound.RollOffMaxDistance with a linear squared relationship.

@roblox/enum/RollOffMode.InverseTapered.documentation: A hybrid model. Follows the Inverse model when close to Sound.RollOffMinDistance and the Linear Square model when close to Sound.RollOffMaxDistance.

@roblox/enum/RollOffMode.documentation: How 3D Sounds attenuate (fade out) as the distance between the listener and the Sound's parent increases.

@roblox/enum/DialogTone.Neutral.documentation: Causes the dialog to have a blue bar on its left-hand side.

@roblox/enum/DialogTone.Friendly.documentation: Causes the dialog to have a green bar on its left-hand side.

@roblox/enum/DialogTone.Enemy.documentation: Causes the dialog to have a red bar on its left-hand side.

@roblox/enum/DialogTone.documentation: Sets the Dialog.Tone of a Dialog object, which influences how the dialog appears.

@roblox/enum/MouseBehavior.Default.documentation: The mouse moves freely around the user's screen.

@roblox/enum/MouseBehavior.LockCenter.documentation: The mouse is locked, and cannot move from, the center of the user's screen.

@roblox/enum/MouseBehavior.LockCurrentPo.documentation: The mouse is locked, and cannot move from, it's current position on the user's screen at the time of locking.

@roblox/enum/ScreenInsets.None.documentation: No insets are added to the fullscreen area. This mode may result in UI that is obscured or completely hidden by device notches and cutouts, so you should only use it for a ScreenGui that contains noninteractive content like background images.

@roblox/enum/ScreenInsets.DeviceSafeInse.documentation: Device safe area insets are added to the fullscreen area. The resulting area is guaranteed to not be occluded by any device screen cutouts such as the camera notch, although no inset is added for Roblox core UI elements like the top bar buttons. As such, it's recommended that you use CoreUISafeInsets for a ScreenGui whose contents should remain unobscured by both device cutouts and core screen elements.

@roblox/enum/ScreenInsets.CoreUISafeInse.documentation: Core UI insets are added to the DeviceSafeInsets area, resulting in an area guaranteed to be unobscured by both device screen cutouts and Roblox core UI elements like the top bar buttons. This mode is recommended for any ScreenGui that contains interactive and/or important UI elements such as buttons and status messages.

@roblox/enum/ScreenInsets.TopbarSafeInse.documentation: Top bar safe area insets are added to the DeviceSafeInsets area, resulting in an area guaranteed to be unobscured by both device screen cutouts and Roblox core UI elements like the experience controls. Unlike CoreUISafeInsets, this area's position and size is dynamic and is limited to the space available within the top bar area itself, outside of CoreUISafeInsets.

@roblox/enum/ScreenInsets.documentation: Insets associated with various screen safe areas.

@roblox/enum/MeshPartDetailLevel.Distanc.documentation: Select level of detail based on distance (default behavior as in game).

@roblox/enum/MeshPartDetailLevel.documentation: The level of detail of MeshParts displayed in Studio.

@roblox/enum/FriendStatus.Unknown.documentation: The friendship status of two players is unknown.

@roblox/enum/FriendStatus.FriendRequestS.documentation: At least one of two players has sent a friend request to the other player.

@roblox/enum/FriendStatus.FriendRequestR.documentation: At least one of two players has received a friend request sent by the other player.

@roblox/enum/PlayerActions.documentation: References a movement action taken by a player.

@roblox/enum/Status.documentation: It has been used with the unfinished RbxStatus library.

@roblox/enum/KeywordFilterType.documentation: Determines if a filter is 'inclusive' or 'exclusive'.

@roblox/enum/FunctionalTestResult.Warnin.documentation: The test run is potentially unstable.

@roblox/enum/FunctionalTestResult.documentation: Status of a single functional test run.

@roblox/enum/TouchCameraMovementMode.Def.documentation: Default mode used by Roblox Core Scripts.

@roblox/enum/TouchCameraMovementMode.Cla.documentation: Default mode used by Roblox Core Scripts.

@roblox/enum/TouchCameraMovementMode.Fol.documentation: Camera moves with the subject and rotates to keep the subject in the center.

@roblox/enum/TouchCameraMovementMode.Orb.documentation: The camera locks at a certain angle. Once it's set, players can rotate the camera, but it will always maintain a consistent angle to the ground.

@roblox/enum/TouchCameraMovementMode.documentation: Changes the touch camera movement mode currently in-use by the client using a TouchEnabled device.

@roblox/enum/DeviceType.Unknown.documentation: The client is an unknown device.

@roblox/enum/DeviceType.Desktop.documentation: The client is a desktop device.

@roblox/enum/DeviceType.Tablet.documentation: The client is a tablet device.

@roblox/enum/DeviceType.Phone.documentation: The client is a phone device.

@roblox/enum/DragDetectorDragStyle.Trans.documentation: 1D motion along the detector's Axis, by default the world Y axis.
2D motion in the plane perpendicular to the detector's Axis, by default the world XZ plane.
2D motion in the plane perpendicular to the detector's Axis and, when the modifier is active, 1D motion along the detector's Axis.
1D motion along the detector's Axis and, when the modifier is active, 2D motion in the plane perpendicular to the detector's Axis.
2D motion in the plane perpendicular to the camera's view. In this mode, the plane is constantly updated, even while dragging, and will always face the camera's current view.

@roblox/enum/DragDetectorDragStyle.Rotat.documentation: Rotation about the detector's Axis, by default the world Y axis.
Trackball rotation, further customized through the TrackballRadialPullFactor and TrackballRollFactor properties.

@roblox/enum/DragDetectorDragStyle.Scrip.documentation: Calculates desired motion via a custom function provided through SetDragStyleFunction().

@roblox/enum/DragDetectorDragStyle.BestF.documentation: TranslatePlaneOrLine for mouse and gamepad; TranslatePlane for touch; 6DOF for VR.

@roblox/enum/VRTouchpadMode.Touch.documentation: The touchpad is treated as ButtonB if it is the left touchpad, or ButtonA if it is the right touchpad.

@roblox/enum/VRTouchpadMode.VirtualThumb.documentation: The touchpad will function as a gamepad joystick.

@roblox/enum/VRTouchpadMode.ABXY.documentation: The touchpad will function as a means of inputting the standard ABXY gamepad input, dividing it up into 4 diagonal pie slices.

@roblox/enum/VRTouchpadMode.documentation: Used to identify the behavior of a specified VR touchpad.

@roblox/enum/KeyInterpolationMode.Consta.documentation: The segment starting at this key will constantly evaluate to the value set at this key.

@roblox/enum/KeyInterpolationMode.Linear.documentation: The segment starting at this key will evaluate using a linear interpolation at this key and the value at the next key.

@roblox/enum/KeyInterpolationMode.Cubic.documentation: The segment starting at this key will evaluate using cubic interpolation of this key value using its right tangent and the next key value and its left tangent.

@roblox/enum/KeyInterpolationMode.documentation: Describes the interpolation method between two keys.

@roblox/enum/ForceLimitMode.Magnitude.documentation: A single number is used to specify the magnitude of the maximum constraint force. The constraint will ensure that the force it applies will have a magnitude that is less than this limit.

@roblox/enum/ForceLimitMode.PerAxis.documentation: A vector is used to specify the maximum force value along each axis of a given reference frame. The constraint will ensure that each component of the force will have an absolute value that's less than the corresponding vector entry.

@roblox/enum/ForceLimitMode.documentation:
The ForceLimitMode enum determines how the maximum force for a constraint is specified and how that limit is enforced by the constraint.
.

@roblox/enum/MeshType.Head.documentation: The mesh is the default Humanoid head mesh.

@roblox/enum/MeshType.Torso.documentation: The mesh is the default Humanoid torso mesh.

@roblox/enum/MeshType.FileMesh.documentation: The mesh is determined by the Roblox mesh asset id provided.

@roblox/enum/MeshType.Brick.documentation: The mesh is a brick (just like the shape of a default BasePart).

@roblox/enum/MeshType.ParallelRamp.documentation: The mesh is a parallel ramp.

@roblox/enum/MeshType.RightAngleRamp.documentation: The mesh is a right angle ramp.

@roblox/enum/MeshType.CornerWedge.documentation: The mesh is a corner wedge.

@roblox/enum/MeshType.documentation: The MeshType Enum is used to set what type of mesh the SpecialMesh is.

@roblox/enum/FontStyle.Normal.documentation: The text renders normally with this font.

@roblox/enum/FontStyle.Italic.documentation: The text renders italic with this font.

@roblox/enum/FontStyle.documentation: Describes whether a Font is italic or not.

@roblox/enum/GraphicsMode.Automatic.documentation: Roblox will automatically decide what graphics mode to use, depending on what best suits your device's specifications.

@roblox/enum/GraphicsMode.NoGraphics.documentation: Game will not be rendered, and instead a Diagnostics window is rendered on screen.

@roblox/enum/GraphicsMode.documentation: Used to set the graphics API that Roblox uses to render the game.

@roblox/enum/ProductPurchaseDecision.Not.documentation: The purchase request has been sent but not yet processed.

@roblox/enum/ProductPurchaseDecision.Pur.documentation: The purchase has been processed and granted to the user who initiated the purchase request.

@roblox/enum/ProductPurchaseDecision.documentation: The ProductPurchaseDecisionEnum is used to work with MarketplaceService, and the sale of developer products.

@roblox/enum/VRScaling.World.documentation: Adjusts `Class.Camera.HeadScale' so that the world in VR is seen from the avatar's perspective.

@roblox/enum/BodyPart.documentation: The BodyPart Enum determines which BodyPart a CharacterMesh affects.

@roblox/enum/VRTouchpad.documentation: Used to universally identify a VR touchpad that is used by either the left, or right hand.

@roblox/enum/SafeAreaCompatibility.None.documentation: Do not apply compatibility transformations to any descendants of the ScreenGui.

@roblox/enum/SafeAreaCompatibility.Fulls.documentation: If the total area of any descendant GuiObject within the ScreenGui (including any applied border or UIStroke) covers the device's safe area both horizontally and vertically, its background area will be expanded to cover the fullscreen area. This expansion does not affect the size or position of the descendant's content, except in the case of ImageLabel, ImageButton, or VideoFrame where the image/video is considered part of the background and will be expanded to fullscreen. Note that this option is intended to automatically improve the appearance of UI that was authored for screens without any cutouts. However, it's recommended that you avoid fullscreen extensions for new work; instead, use the ScreenInsets property to specify which insets should be respected for different ScreenGuis.

@roblox/enum/SafeAreaCompatibility.documentation: Describes how descendants of a ScreenGui adapt to screens with cutouts.

@roblox/enum/ModelLevelOfDetail.Streamin.documentation: A lower resolution "imposter" mesh (colored, coarse mesh that wraps around all child parts of the model) renders outside the streaming radius.

@roblox/enum/ModelLevelOfDetail.Disabled.documentation: A lower resolution mesh will not be displayed.

@roblox/enum/ModelLevelOfDetail.documentation: Controls the level of detail for Models in experiences with instance streaming enabled.

@roblox/enum/AutomaticSize.X.documentation: Automatically resize element along X-axis to fit child contents.

@roblox/enum/AutomaticSize.Y.documentation: Automatically resize element along Y-axis to fit child contents. Text Objects will only resize along the Y-axis if TextWrapped is enabled.

@roblox/enum/AutomaticSize.XY.documentation: Automatically resize element along X and Y axes to fit child contents.

@roblox/enum/AutomaticSize.documentation: UI objects with AutomaticSize enabled will increase in size up to maximum size allowed by the parent (if there is one) and no smaller than the Size property bounds.

@roblox/enum/ChatVersion.TextChatService.documentation: Enables TextChatService chat and prevents legacy chat system behavior.

@roblox/enum/ChatVersion.documentation: Determines whether TextChatService should be fully enabled or to allow the legacy system.

@roblox/enum/TeleportResult.Failure.documentation: The teleport failed for an unknown reason.

@roblox/enum/TeleportResult.GameNotFound.documentation: The game that this player attempted to teleport to could not be found.

@roblox/enum/TeleportResult.GameEnded.documentation: The game that this player attempted to teleport to has ended.

@roblox/enum/TeleportResult.GameFull.documentation: The game that this player attempted to teleport to is full.

@roblox/enum/TeleportResult.Unauthorized.documentation: The player is not authorized to complete this teleport.

@roblox/enum/TeleportResult.Flooded.documentation: Too many teleport requests have been made recently.

@roblox/enum/TeleportResult.IsTeleportin.documentation: The player is currently being teleported.

@roblox/enum/TeleportResult.documentation: Describes the result of a teleport.

@roblox/enum/TweenStatus.Canceled.documentation: The tween was cancelled before completion.

@roblox/enum/TweenStatus.documentation: The completion status of a GuiObject tween function.

@roblox/enum/AvatarAssetType.DressSkirtA.documentation: A layered clothing dress or skirt.

@roblox/enum/AvatarAssetType.documentation: Describes the asset types that an avatar can equip.

@roblox/enum/ProximityPromptExclusivity..documentation: One prompt will be shown per input KeyCode.
Only one prompt will be shown with this setting.
This prompt will always show when in range and visible.

@roblox/enum/ModelStreamingMode.Default.documentation: Engine determines best behavior. Currently equivalent to Nonatomic.

@roblox/enum/ModelStreamingMode.Atomic.documentation: The Model and all of its descendants are streamed in/out together. For streaming in, this applies when any descendant BasePart is eligible for streaming in. For streaming out, this applies when all descendant BaseParts are eligible for streaming out.

@roblox/enum/ModelStreamingMode.Persiste.documentation: Persistent models are sent as a complete atomic unit soon after the player joins and before the Workspace.PersistentLoaded event fires. Persistent models and their descendants are never streamed out.

Behaves as a persistent model for players that have been added using Model:AddPersistentPlayer(). For other players, behavior is the same as Atomic. You can revert a model from player persistence via Model:RemovePersistentPlayer().

@roblox/enum/ModelStreamingMode.Nonatomi.documentation: When a nonatomic model is streamed, descendants are also sent, except for part descendants. Nonatomic models that are not descendants of parts are sent during experience loading.

@roblox/enum/ModelStreamingMode.documentation: Controls stream in and out behavior of a model.

@roblox/enum/BundleType.BodyParts.documentation: A bundle of body parts and accessories.

@roblox/enum/BundleType.Shoes.documentation: A bundle of left shoe and right shoe.

@roblox/enum/BundleType.DynamicHead.documentation: A bundle consisting of dynamicHead and moodAnimation assets, optionally with eyebrowAccessory and eyelashAccessory.

@roblox/enum/BundleType.documentation: The type of a bundle of assets.

@roblox/enum/NormalId.Right.documentation: The right face of a Part.

@roblox/enum/NormalId.Top.documentation: The top face of a Part.

@roblox/enum/NormalId.Back.documentation: The back face of a Part.

@roblox/enum/NormalId.Left.documentation: The left face of a Part.

@roblox/enum/NormalId.Bottom.documentation: The bottom face of a Part.

@roblox/enum/NormalId.Front.documentation: The front face of a Part.

@roblox/enum/NormalId.documentation: The NormalId Enum sets which side/face of a Part is used.

@roblox/enum/DevComputerCameraMovementMo.documentation: The camera will move based on the player's settings.
Camera tracks the player but will not automatically rotate if the player walks left or right.
Camera tracks the player and automatically rotates if the player walks left or right.
The camera has a fixed Y position, but can be rotated around the player.
The camera toggles between locked and free rotation with the right mouse button.
Overwrites the player's camera movement mode setting on a computer.

@roblox/enum/DevCameraOcclusionMode.Zoom.documentation: The camera zooms in until there is nothing between it and its subject.

@roblox/enum/DevCameraOcclusionMode.Invi.documentation: Any objects between the camera and its subject become translucent locally.

@roblox/enum/DevCameraOcclusionMode.documentation: Determines how the default camera handles objects that are in-between the camera and the camera subject.

@roblox/enum/MaterialPattern.Regular.documentation: Material has ordered pattern, usually man-made, like brick or wood planks.

@roblox/enum/MaterialPattern.Organic.documentation: Material pattern has less repetition, like stone or dirt.

@roblox/enum/MaterialPattern.documentation: Describes the pattern of material. Affects texture tiling method.

@roblox/enum/NetworkOwnership.Automatic.documentation: Network ownership is determined automatically by the server.

@roblox/enum/NetworkOwnership.Manual.documentation: Network ownership is set manually by the developer.

@roblox/enum/NetworkOwnership.OnContact.documentation: The first player to touch a part is given ownership of that part for the server (network). Ownership will not change if another player touches that part unless network ownership has been released by the owner.

@roblox/enum/NetworkOwnership.documentation: Defines how simulation authority is determined for the Network Ownership Unit/Mechanism this part is attached to.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidHealthDisplayType.D.documentation: The humanoid's health bar is only visible when the humanoid is not at full health (assuming MaxHealth is greater than zero).

@roblox/enum/HumanoidHealthDisplayType.A.documentation: The humanoid's health bar is always visible (assuming MaxHealth is greater than zero).
The humanoid's health bar is never visible.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidHealthDisplayType.documentation: Controls under what circumstances the Humanoid health bar is displayed.

@roblox/enum/ProximityPromptStyle.Custom.documentation: Custom prompt UI style as set by the developer. For more information, see ProximityPrompt.Style.

@roblox/enum/AnalyticsEconomyAction.Defa.documentation: Default action. Used for an undefined Action.

@roblox/enum/AnalyticsEconomyAction.Acqu.documentation: Indicates the acquisition of an in game resource. For example, a player acquires virtual currency by completing a specific in game task.

@roblox/enum/AnalyticsEconomyAction.Spen.documentation: Indicates the spending or loss of an in game resource. For example, a player spends virtual currency to acquire a new item.

@roblox/enum/CurrencyType.documentation: The CurrencyType Enum is used with MarketplaceService to set the currency used.

@roblox/enum/ListenerType.ObjectPosition.documentation: Uses the world position of an instance and the rotation of CurrentCamera.

@roblox/enum/ListenerType.ObjectCFrame.documentation: Uses the world CFrame from an instance.

@roblox/enum/ListenerType.documentation: Defines where and how the listener is positioned when picking up spatial audio.

@roblox/enum/EasingDirection.In.documentation: The easing style is applied in a forward direction.

@roblox/enum/EasingDirection.Out.documentation: The easing style is applied in a reverse direction.

@roblox/enum/EasingDirection.InOut.documentation: The easing style is applied forward for the first half and in reverse for the second half.

@roblox/enum/EasingDirection.documentation: Pass to TweenInfo.new() to control the direction Tweens play in.

@roblox/enum/ThrottlingPriority.Elevated.documentation: Less throttling if on the server.

@roblox/enum/FluidForces.Default.documentation: Aerodynamic forces will not be calculated on any BaseParts.

@roblox/enum/FluidForces.Experimental.documentation: Aerodynamic forces will be calculated on BaseParts with EnableFluidForces set to true. During the beta phase, the behavior of the aerodynamic force model may change as the model improves.

@roblox/enum/FluidForces.documentation: Controls the enablement of aerodynamic forces on parts and assemblies in the workspace.

@roblox/enum/AvatarItemType.documentation: The type (Asset or Bundle) of avatar items.

@roblox/enum/InviteState.documentation: Describes a player's call invite state.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidRigType.R6.documentation: Indicates that a character is using the legacy R6 rig.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidRigType.R15.documentation: Indicates that a character is using the new R15 rig.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidRigType.documentation: Describes whether or not a character is using the new R15 rig, or the legacy R6 rig.

@roblox/enum/Material.ForceField.documentation: Must be used on a MeshPart with UVs laid out to cover much of the 0:1 UV space or more (larger is better). The MeshPart must also have a texture applied to its TextureID, and that texture image must have a wide value range since the material displays the range from dark/black to light/white values. Obtain this model for a functional example of the ForceField material.

@roblox/enum/InfoType.Asset.documentation: Asset format type - the product is an asset.

@roblox/enum/InfoType.Product.documentation: Product format type - the product is a produce (e.g. Developer product).

@roblox/enum/InfoType.GamePass.documentation: GamePass format type - the product is a GamePass.

@roblox/enum/OutputLayoutMode.documentation: Sets the layout mode of the output.

@roblox/enum/DebuggerFrameType.C.documentation: Call stack frame belongs to a C (native) function.

@roblox/enum/DebuggerFrameType.Lua.documentation: Call stack frame belongs to a Lua function.

@roblox/enum/DialogPurpose.documentation: The DialogPurpose enum is used to set the icon of a Dialog.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.Audio.documentation: The asset is an audio clip.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.Lua.documentation: The asset is Lua code, for example a ModuleScript.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.Pants.documentation: The asset is a pants item.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.Gear.documentation: The asset is a gear item.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.Animation.documentation: The asset is an animation; also see the more specific animation type enums below.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.RightArm.documentation: The asset is a right arm.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.LeftArm.documentation: The asset is a left arm.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.LeftLeg.documentation: The asset is a left leg.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.RightLeg.documentation: The asset is a right leg.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.Package.documentation: The asset is a pack, for example an animation package.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.MeshPart.documentation: The asset is a mesh part.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.HairAccessory.documentation: The asset is a hair accessory.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.FaceAccessory.documentation: The asset is a face accessory.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.NeckAccessory.documentation: The asset is a neck accessory.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.ShoulderAccessory.documentation: The asset is a shoulder accessory.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.FrontAccessory.documentation: The asset is a front accessory.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.BackAccessory.documentation: The asset is a back accessory.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.WaistAccessory.documentation: The asset is a waist accessory.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.ClimbAnimation.documentation: The asset is a climb animation.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.DeathAnimation.documentation: The asset is a death animation.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.FallAnimation.documentation: The asset is a fall animation.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.IdleAnimation.documentation: The asset is an idle animation.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.JumpAnimation.documentation: The asset is a jump animation.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.RunAnimation.documentation: The asset is a run animation.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.SwimAnimation.documentation: The asset is a swim animation.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.WalkAnimation.documentation: The asset is a walk animation.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.PoseAnimation.documentation: The asset is a pose animation.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.EmoteAnimation.documentation: The asset is an emote animation.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.documentation: This Enum can be used to match the AssetTypeId from MarketplaceService:GetProductInfo() to an asset type.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.FallingDo.documentation: The Humanoid has been tripped, and will attempt to get up in a few moments.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.Ragdoll.documentation: (Deprecated) The Humanoid has been hit by a fast moving object (uncontrolled falling). The Humanoid can recover from this. This state has to be set and unset manually using Humanoid:ChangeState().

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.GettingUp.documentation: The Humanoid is getting back on their feet after FallingDown or Ragdoll.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.Jumping.documentation: The Humanoid just jumped. (Check Humanoid.Jump). This state lasts only briefly. This state normally transitions into either Landed, if on the ground, or Freefall, if still in the air.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.Swimming.documentation: The Humanoid is currently swimming in Terrain water.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.Freefall.documentation: The Humanoid is currently freefalling (jumped from a height or fell off a ledge).

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.Flying.documentation: When set, the Humanoid won't be animated, as with the Humanoid.PlatformStand property. This state lasts as long as the player flies.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.Landed.documentation: The Humanoid touched the ground after a Freefall. This state lasts only briefly.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.Running.documentation: Currently running while on the ground.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.RunningNo.documentation: (Deprecated) Currently running and not near other physical objects.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.StrafingN.documentation: Not currently used with default Humanoid. Cannot be set with Humanoid:ChangeState().

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.Climbing.documentation: The Humanoid is climbing (e.g. up a TrussPart or ladder).

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.Seated.documentation: The Humanoid is currently sitting in a Seat or VehicleSeat. Check the Humanoid.Sit property.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.PlatformS.documentation: The Humanoid is platformstanding. Check the Humanoid.PlatformStand property.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.Dead.documentation: The Humanoid died. Changing a Humanoid's state to this state will kill it.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.Physics.documentation: The Humanoid doesn't apply any force on its own and will not automatically transition to any other state. This state has to be set and unset manually using Humanoid:ChangeState().

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.None.documentation: Unusable placeholder in case an unknown state gets triggered internally.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.documentation: Describes the physics control states within the Humanoid.

@roblox/enum/ContextActionResult.Sink.documentation: If functionToBind from ContextActionService:BindAction() returns Enum.ContextActionResult.Sink, the input event will stop at that function and no other bound actions under it will be . This is the default behavior if functionToBind does not return anything or yields in any way.

@roblox/enum/ContextActionResult.Pass.documentation: If functionToBind from ContextActionService:BindAction() returns Enum.ContextActionResult.Pass, the input event is considered to have not been handled by functionToBind and will continue being passed to actions bound to the same input type.

@roblox/enum/ContextActionResult.documentation: Describes whether a ContextAction should sink or pass input events.

@roblox/enum/IKCollisionsMode.NoCollisio.documentation: Only the part and any parts directly joined to it via joints/constraints be involved in the resolution, everything else in the workspace will be treated as though it doesn't exist.

@roblox/enum/IKCollisionsMode.OtherMecha.documentation: Only the part and any parts directly jointed to it via joints/constraints will be moved during resolution, but they will collide with other objects in the workspace.

@roblox/enum/IKCollisionsMode.IncludeCon.documentation: The part, any parts directly joined to it via joints/constraints, and any parts which it comes into contact with during the solve will be moved during the resolution. That is, the moved parts will be allowed to "push" other unanchored parts in the workspace out of the way in order to get to the target position.

@luau/global/math.abs.documentation: Returns the absolute value of x.

@luau/global/math.acos.documentation: Returns the arc cosine of x.

@luau/global/math.asin.documentation: Returns the arc sine of x.

@luau/global/math.atan.documentation: Returns the arc tangent of x (in radians).

@luau/global/math.atan2.documentation: Returns the arc tangent of y/x (in radians) while using the signs of both parameters to find the quadrant of the result.

@luau/global/math.ceil.documentation: Returns the smallest integer larger than or equal to x.

@luau/global/math.cos.documentation: Returns the cosine of x (assumed to be in radians).

@luau/global/math.cosh.documentation: Returns the hyperbolic cosine of x.

@luau/global/math.deg.documentation: Returns the angle x (given in radians) in degrees.

@luau/global/math.floor.documentation: Returns the largest integer smaller than or equal to x.

@luau/global/math.fmod.documentation: Returns the remainder of the division of x by y that rounds the quotient towards zero.

@luau/global/math.frexp.documentation: Returns m and e such that x = m*2^e.

@luau/global/math.ldexp.documentation: Returns x*2^e (e should be an integer).

@luau/global/math.log/param/1.documentation: The base of the logarithm, the constant e by default.

@luau/global/math.log.documentation: Returns the logarithm of x using the given base.

@luau/global/math.log10.documentation: Returns the base-10 logarithm of x.

@luau/global/math.max.documentation: Returns the maximum value among the numbers passed to the function.

@luau/global/math.min.documentation: Returns the minimum value among the numbers passed to the function.

@luau/global/math.modf.documentation: Returns two numbers, the integral part of x and the fractional part of x.

@luau/global/math.rad.documentation: Returns the angle x (given in degrees) in radians.

@luau/global/math.random.documentation: Returns a random number within the range provided.

@luau/global/math.randomseed.documentation: Sets x as the seed for the pseudo-random generator.

@luau/global/math.round.documentation: Returns the integer with the smallest difference between it and the given number.

@luau/global/math.sign.documentation: Returns -1 if x < 0, 0 if x == 0, or 1 if x > 0.

@luau/global/math.sin.documentation: Returns the sine of x (assumed to be in radians).

@luau/global/math.sinh.documentation: Returns the hyperbolic sine of x.

@luau/global/math.sqrt.documentation: Returns the square root of x.

@luau/global/math.tan.documentation: Returns the tangent of x (assumed to be in radians).

@luau/global/math.tanh.documentation: Returns the hyperbolic tangent of x.

@luau/global/bit32.documentation: A library of functions to perform bitwise operations.

@luau/global/bit32.arshift/param/0.documentation: The number whose bits shall be shifted.

@luau/global/bit32.arshift/param/1.documentation: The integer number of bits to shift by.

@luau/global/bit32.arshift.documentation: Returns a number after its bits have been arithmetically shifted to the right by a given displacement.

@luau/global/bit32.band.documentation: Returns the bitwise AND of all provided numbers.

@luau/global/bit32.bnot.documentation: Returns the bitwise negation of a given number.

@luau/global/bit32.bor.documentation: Returns the bitwise OR of all provided numbers.

@luau/global/bit32.btest.documentation: Returns a boolean describing whether the bitwise and of its operands is different from zero.

@luau/global/bit32.bxor.documentation: Returns the bitwise XOR of all provided numbers.

@luau/global/bit32.countlz.documentation: Returns the number of consecutive zero bits in the 32-bit representation of the provided number starting from the left-most (most significant) bit.

@luau/global/bit32.countrz.documentation: Returns the number of consecutive zero bits in the 32-bit representation of the provided number starting from the right-most (least significant) bit.

@luau/global/bit32.extract.documentation: Extract a range of bits from a number and return them as an unsigned number.

@luau/global/bit32.replace.documentation: Return a copy of a number with a range of bits replaced by a given value.

@luau/global/bit32.lrotate.documentation: Returns a number after its bits have been rotated to the left by a given number of times.

@luau/global/bit32.lshift.documentation: Returns a number whose bits have been logically shifted to the left by a given displacement.

@luau/global/bit32.rrotate.documentation: Returns a number after its bits have been rotated to the right by a given number of times.

@luau/global/bit32.rshift.documentation: Returns a number whose bits have been logically shifted to the right by a given displacement.

@roblox/global/buffer.fromstring.documentation: Creates a buffer from a string.

@roblox/global/buffer.tostring.documentation: Converts a buffer to a string.

@roblox/global/buffer.len.documentation: Returns the size of the buffer in bytes.

@roblox/global/buffer.readi8/param/1.documentation: Offset from the beginning of the buffer memory, starting from 0.

@roblox/global/buffer.readi8.documentation: Reads an 8-bit signed integer from the buffer.

@roblox/global/buffer.readu8/param/1.documentation: Offset from the beginning of the buffer memory, starting from 0.

@roblox/global/buffer.readu8.documentation: Reads an 8-bit unsigned integer from the buffer.

@roblox/global/buffer.readi16/param/1.documentation: Offset from the beginning of the buffer memory, starting from 0.

@roblox/global/buffer.readi16.documentation: Reads a 16-bit signed integer from the buffer.

@roblox/global/buffer.readu16/param/1.documentation: Offset from the beginning of the buffer memory, starting from 0.

@roblox/global/buffer.readu16.documentation: Reads a 16-bit unsigned integer from the buffer.

@roblox/global/buffer.readi32/param/1.documentation: Offset from the beginning of the buffer memory, starting from 0.

@roblox/global/buffer.readi32.documentation: Reads a 32-bit signed integer from the buffer.

@roblox/global/buffer.readu32/param/1.documentation: Offset from the beginning of the buffer memory, starting from 0.

@roblox/global/buffer.readu32.documentation: Reads a 32-bit unsigned integer from the buffer.

@roblox/global/buffer.readf32/param/1.documentation: Offset from the beginning of the buffer memory, starting from 0.

@roblox/global/buffer.readf32.documentation: Reads a 32-bit floating-point value from the buffer.

@roblox/global/buffer.readf64/param/1.documentation: Offset from the beginning of the buffer memory, starting from 0.

@roblox/global/buffer.readf64.documentation: Reads a 64-bit floating-point value from the buffer.

@roblox/global/buffer.writei8/param/1.documentation: Offset from the beginning of the buffer memory, starting from 0.

@roblox/global/buffer.writei8.documentation: Writes an 8-bit signed integer to the buffer.

@roblox/global/buffer.writeu8/param/1.documentation: Offset from the beginning of the buffer memory, starting from 0.

@roblox/global/buffer.writeu8.documentation: Writes an 8-bit unsigned integer to the buffer.

@roblox/global/buffer.writei16/param/1.documentation: Offset from the beginning of the buffer memory, starting from 0.

@roblox/global/buffer.writei16.documentation: Writes a 16-bit signed integer to the buffer.

@roblox/global/buffer.writeu16/param/1.documentation: Offset from the beginning of the buffer memory, starting from 0.

@roblox/global/buffer.writeu16.documentation: Writes a 16-bit unsigned integer to the buffer.

@roblox/global/buffer.writei32/param/1.documentation: Offset from the beginning of the buffer memory, starting from 0.

@roblox/global/buffer.writei32.documentation: Writes a 32-bit signed integer to the buffer.

@roblox/global/buffer.writeu32/param/1.documentation: Offset from the beginning of the buffer memory, starting from 0.

@roblox/global/buffer.writeu32.documentation: Writes a 32-bit unsigned integer to the buffer.

@roblox/global/buffer.writef32/param/1.documentation: Offset from the beginning of the buffer memory, starting from 0.

@roblox/global/buffer.writef32.documentation: Writes a 32-bit floating-point value to the buffer.

@roblox/global/buffer.writef64/param/1.documentation: Offset from the beginning of the buffer memory, starting from 0.

@roblox/global/buffer.writef64.documentation: Writes a 64-bit floating-point value to the buffer.

@roblox/global/buffer.readstring/param/1.documentation: Offset from the beginning of the buffer memory, starting from 0.

@roblox/global/buffer.readstring.documentation: Reads a string from the buffer.

@roblox/global/buffer.writestring/param/.documentation: Offset from the beginning of the buffer memory, starting from 0.
Number of bytes to take from the string. This value cannot be larger than the string length.

@roblox/global/buffer.writestring.documentation: Writes a string to the buffer.

@roblox/global/buffer.copy/param/1.documentation: Offset from the beginning of the buffer memory, starting from 0.

@roblox/global/buffer.copy/param/2.documentation: Buffer to take the data from.

@roblox/global/buffer.copy/param/3.documentation: Offset from the beginning of the buffer memory, starting from 0.

@roblox/global/buffer.copy/param/4.documentation: Number of bytes to copy. If omitted, the whole source data starting from sourceOffset is taken.

@roblox/global/buffer.fill/param/0.documentation: Buffer to write the data into.

@roblox/global/buffer.fill/param/1.documentation: Offset from the beginning of the buffer memory, starting from 0.

@roblox/global/buffer.fill/param/3.documentation: Number of bytes to write. If omitted, all bytes after the specified offset are set.

@roblox/global/buffer.fill.documentation: Sets a region of the buffer memory to some 8-bit unsigned integer value.

@luau/global/os.documentation: This library provides functions related to time and date.

@luau/global/os.time/param/0.documentation: A dictionary table describing a specific time, similar to that returned by os.date(). If not provided, uses the current UTC time.

@luau/global/os.time.documentation: Returns how many seconds have passed since the Unix epoch (1 January 1970, 00:00:00) under current UTC time.

@luau/global/os.difftime.documentation: Returns the number of seconds from t1 to t2, assuming the arguments are correctly casted to the time_t format.

@luau/global/os.date.documentation: Formats the given string with date/time information based on the given time (or if not provided, the value returned by os.time).

@luau/global/os.clock.documentation: Returns a high-precision amount of CPU time used by Lua in seconds, intended for use in benchmarking.

@roblox/global/task.documentation: Allows for functions and threads to be coordinated with the Task Scheduler.

@roblox/global/task.spawn/param/0.documentation: A function or a thread returned by coroutine.create.

@roblox/global/task.spawn/param/1.documentation: Arguments to send to the function or thread.

@roblox/global/task.spawn.documentation: Calls/resumes a function/coroutine immediately through the engine scheduler.

@roblox/global/task.defer/param/0.documentation: A function or a thread returned by coroutine.create.

@roblox/global/task.defer/param/1.documentation: Arguments to send to the function or thread.

@roblox/global/task.defer.documentation: Calls/resumes a function/coroutine on the next resumption cycle.

@roblox/global/task.delay/param/0.documentation: The minimum number of seconds that must pass before the function/thread is called/resumed.

@roblox/global/task.delay/param/2.documentation: Arguments to be passed to the function/thread when it is due to be called/resumed.

@roblox/global/task.delay.documentation: Schedules a function/coroutine to be called/resumed on the next Heartbeat after the given duration (in seconds) has passed, without throttling.

@roblox/global/task.desynchronize.documentation: Causes the following code to be run in parallel.

@roblox/global/task.synchronize.documentation: Causes the following code to be run in serial.

@roblox/global/task.wait/param/0.documentation: The amount of time in seconds that should elapse before the current thread is resumed.

@roblox/global/task.wait.documentation: Yields the current thread until the next Heartbeat in which the given duration (in seconds) has passed, without throttling.

@roblox/global/task.cancel/param/0.documentation: The thread that will be cancelled.

@roblox/global/task.cancel.documentation: Cancels a thread, preventing it from being resumed.

@luau/global/debug.documentation: This library provides functions useful for debugging and profiling code.

@luau/global/debug.traceback/overload/(s.documentation: The first line of the returned string.
The number of calls "up" the call stack to return.
Traceback of the current function call stack.
Returns a string of undefined format that describes the current function call stack.

@luau/global/debug.traceback/overload/(t.documentation: The first line of the returned string.
The number of calls "up" the call stack to return.
Traceback of the current function call stack.
Returns a string of undefined format that describes the current function call stack.

@luau/global/debug.info/overload/(number.documentation: Determines at what level of the call stack the information returned should describe. A value of 1 represents the function which is calling debug.info(), a value of 2 represents the function that called that function, and so on.

A string that describes what the returned information should represent. It must only contain 0 or 1 instances of the characters slnaf, each representing a piece of information:
  • s (string) — The function source identifier, equal to the full name of the script the function is defined in.
  • l (number) — The line number of the function call represented by level.
  • n (string) — The name of the function; may be nil for anonymous functions and C functions without an assigned debug name.
  • a (number, boolean) — Arity of the function, which refers to the parameter count and whether the function is variadic.
  • f (function) — The function which was inspected.
Traverses the entire stack of current thread and returns a string containing the call stack of target level details.

@luau/global/debug.info/overload/(functi.documentation: The function of the call stack which the information returned should describe.

A string that describes what the returned information should represent. It must only contain 0 or 1 instances of the characters slnaf, each representing a piece of information:
  • s (string) — The function source identifier, equal to the full name of the script the function is defined in.
  • l (number) — The line that function is defined on.
  • n (string) — The name of the function; may be nil for anonymous functions and C functions without an assigned debug name.
  • a (number, boolean) — Arity of the function, which refers to the parameter count and whether the function is variadic.
  • f (function) — The function which was inspected.
Traverses the entire stack of current thread and returns a string containing the call stack of target function details.

@luau/global/debug.info/overload/(thread.documentation: Determines at what level of the call stack the information returned should describe. A value of 1 represents the function which is calling debug.info(), a value of 2 represents the function that called that function, and so on.

A string that describes what the returned information should represent. It must only contain 0 or 1 instances of the characters slnaf, each representing a piece of information:
  • s (string) — The function source identifier, equal to the full name of the script the function is defined in.
  • l (number) — The line number of the function call represented by level.
  • n (string) — The name of the function; may be nil for anonymous functions and C functions without an assigned debug name.
  • a (number, boolean) — Arity of the function, which refers to the parameter count and whether the function is variadic.
  • f (function) — The function which was inspected.
Traverses the entire stack of target thread and returns a string containing the call stack of target level details.

@luau/global/debug.profilebegin/param/0.documentation: The text that this MicroProfiler label displays.

@luau/global/debug.profileend.documentation: Stops profiling for the most recent label that debug.profilebegin() opened.

@luau/global/debug.getmemorycategory/ret.documentation: The current thread's active memory category.

@luau/global/debug.getmemorycategory.documentation: Returns the name of the current thread's active memory category.

@luau/global/debug.setmemorycategory/ret.documentation: The current thread's previous memory category.

@luau/global/debug.setmemorycategory.documentation: Assigns a custom tag to the current thread's memory category.

@luau/global/debug.resetmemorycategory.documentation: Resets the tag assigned by debug.setmemorycategory() to the automatically assigned value (typically, the script name).

@luau/global/table.clear/param/0.documentation: The table whose keys will be cleared.

@luau/global/table.clear.documentation: Sets all keys in the given table to nil.

@luau/global/table.clone/return/0.documentation: The clone of the provided table.

@luau/global/table.clone.documentation: Returns a shallow copy of the provided table.

@luau/global/table.concat/param/0.documentation: The table that will be converted into a string.

@luau/global/table.concat/param/1.documentation: The string that will be concatenated between each entry in the table.

@luau/global/table.concat/param/2.documentation: The starting index of the table concatenation.

@luau/global/table.concat/param/3.documentation: The ending index of the table concatenation.

@luau/global/table.concat.documentation: Returns the given range of table elements as a string where each element is separated by the given separator.

@luau/global/table.create.documentation: Returns a new table populated with many instances of the specified value.

@luau/global/table.find.documentation: Returns the index of the first occurrence of needle within haystack starting from init.

@luau/global/table.foreach/param/0.documentation: The table to be iterated over.

@luau/global/table.foreach/param/1.documentation: The function that will be used for the iteration. This function will receive 2 arguments for each iteration, where the 1st argument is the key, and the 2nd argument is the value.

@luau/global/table.foreach.documentation: Iterates over the provided table, passing the key and value of each iteration over to the provided function.

@luau/global/table.foreachi/param/0.documentation: The table to be iterated over.

@luau/global/table.foreachi/param/1.documentation: The function that will be used for the iteration. This function will receive 2 arguments for each iteration, where the 1st argument is the index, and the 2nd argument is the value.

@luau/global/table.foreachi.documentation: Similar to table.foreach() except index-value pairs are passed instead of key-value pairs.

@luau/global/table.getn/param/0.documentation: The table whose size is being measured.

@luau/global/table.getn.documentation: Returns the number of elements in the table passed.

@luau/global/table.insert/overload/(tabl.documentation: The table that is being appended to.
The position at which the value will be inserted.
The value that will be appended to the table.
Inserts the provided value to the target position of the array.
The table that is being appended to.
The value that will be appended to the table.
Appends the provided value to the end of the array.

@luau/global/table.isfrozen/return/0.documentation: Whether the table is frozen from table.freeze().

@luau/global/table.isfrozen.documentation: Returns true if the given table is frozen and false if it isn't frozen.

@luau/global/table.maxn.documentation: Returns the maximum numeric key of the provided table, or zero if the table has no numeric keys.

@luau/global/table.move.documentation: Copies the specified range of elements from one table to another.

@luau/global/table.pack.documentation: Returns a new table containing the provided values.

@luau/global/table.remove/param/0.documentation: The table that is having an element removed.

@luau/global/table.remove/param/1.documentation: The index of the element being removed.

@luau/global/table.remove.documentation: Removes the specified element from the array, shifting later elements down to fill in the empty space if possible.

@luau/global/table.sort/param/1.documentation: An optional comparison function to be used when comparing elements in the table. This function receives two elements, a and b, and should return true if a < b.

@luau/global/table.sort.documentation: Sorts table elements using the provided comparison function or the < operator.

@luau/global/table.unpack/param/0.documentation: The list of elements to be unpacked.

@luau/global/table.unpack/param/1.documentation: The index of the first element to unpack.

@luau/global/table.unpack/param/2.documentation: The index of the last element to unpack.

@luau/global/table.unpack.documentation: Returns all elements from the given list as a tuple.

@luau/global/string.documentation: Provides generic functions to manipulate strings.

@luau/global/string.byte.documentation: Returns the internal numerical codes of the characters s[i], s[i+1], ..., s[j]. The default value for i is 1; the default value for j is i. These indices are corrected following the same rules of function string.sub.

@luau/global/string.char.documentation: Receives zero or more integers and returns a string with length equal to the number of arguments that has each character has the internal numerical code equal to its corresponding argument.

@luau/global/string.find.documentation: Looks for the first match of pattern in the string s and returns the indices of s where the occurrence starts and ends.

@luau/global/string.format.documentation: Returns a formatted version of its variable number of arguments following the description given in its first argument, which must be a string.

@luau/global/string.gmatch.documentation: Returns an iterator function that returns the next captures from pattern over the string s each time it's called.

@luau/global/string.gsub/param/0.documentation: The string whose occurrences of the given pattern shall be replaced.

@luau/global/string.gsub/param/1.documentation: The pattern to be matched and replaced.

@luau/global/string.gsub/param/2.documentation: Determines what should replace the occurrence(s) of the given pattern.

@luau/global/string.gsub/param/3.documentation: The maximum number of substitutions to make.

@luau/global/string.gsub.documentation: Returns a copy of s in which all or the first n occurrences of the pattern are replaced with the given replacement. The second value returned is the total number of substitutions made.

@luau/global/string.len.documentation: Returns the length of a string.

@luau/global/string.lower.documentation: Returns a copy of a string with all uppercase letters changed to lowercase.

@luau/global/string.match.documentation: Looks for the first match of pattern in the string s. If a match is found, it is returned; otherwise, it returns nil. A third, optional numerical argument, init, specifies where to start the search.

@luau/global/string.pack.documentation: Returns a binary string containing the provided arguments.

@luau/global/string.packsize.documentation: Returns the size in bytes of any string packed with a given description.

@luau/global/string.rep.documentation: Returns a string that is the concatenation of n copies of the string s.

@luau/global/string.reverse.documentation: Returns a string that is the string s reversed.

@luau/global/string.split/param/1.documentation: The separator character(s) to be used for splitting the string.

@luau/global/string.split.documentation: Splits a string into parts based on the defined separator character(s), returning a table of ordered results.

@luau/global/string.sub.documentation: Returns the substring of s that starts at i and continues until j. i and j can be negative. i defaults to 1 and j defaults to -1.

@luau/global/string.unpack/return/0.documentation: The values packed into the provided binary string, plus the index of the first unread byte.

@luau/global/string.unpack.documentation: Extracts the values packed in the provided binary string.

@luau/global/string.upper.documentation: Returns a copy of a string with all lowercase letters changed to uppercase.

@luau/global/utf8.documentation: This library provides basic support for UTF-8 encoding.

@luau/global/utf8.char.documentation: Converts zero or more codepoints to UTF-8 byte sequences.

@luau/global/utf8.codes.documentation: Returns an iterator function that iterates over all codepoints in a given string.

@luau/global/utf8.codepoint/param/1.documentation: The index of the codepoint that should be fetched from this string.

@luau/global/utf8.codepoint/param/2.documentation: The index of the last codepoint between i and j that will be returned. If excluded, this will default to the value of i.

@luau/global/utf8.codepoint.documentation: Returns the codepoints (as integers) from all codepoints in a given string.

@luau/global/utf8.len.documentation: Returns the number of UTF-8 codepoints in a given string.

@luau/global/utf8.offset.documentation: Returns the position (in bytes) where the encoding of the n-th codepoint of s (counting from byte position i) starts.

@luau/global/utf8.graphemes.documentation: Returns an iterator function that iterates over the grapheme clusters of a given string.

@luau/global/utf8.nfcnormalize.documentation: Converts the input string to Normal Form C.

@luau/global/utf8.nfdnormalize.documentation: Converts the input string to Normal Form D.

@luau/global/coroutine.documentation: A function that executes alongside the main thread.

@luau/global/coroutine.close/return/0.documentation: true unless the coroutine being closed is in an error state.

@luau/global/coroutine.close.documentation: Closes and puts the provided coroutine in a dead state.

@luau/global/coroutine.create.documentation: Creates a new coroutine, with body f. f must be a Lua function.

@luau/global/coroutine.isyieldable/retur.documentation: Whether or not the coroutine can safely yield at this point.

@luau/global/coroutine.isyieldable.documentation: Returns true if the coroutine this function is called within can safely yield.

@luau/global/coroutine.resume.documentation: Starts or continues the execution of coroutine co.

@luau/global/coroutine.status.documentation: Returns the status of coroutine co as a string.

@luau/global/coroutine.wrap.documentation: Creates a new coroutine and returns a function that, when called, resumes the coroutine.

@luau/global/assert/param/0.documentation: The value that will be asserted against.

@luau/global/assert/param/1.documentation: The text that will be shown in the error if the assertion fails.

@luau/global/assert.documentation: Throws an error if the provided value resolves to false or nil.

@luau/global/collectgarbage/param/0.documentation: The name of the operation that should be performed by the garbage collector.

@luau/global/collectgarbage.documentation: Performs the specified operation of the garbage collector.

@luau/global/error/param/1.documentation: The level of information that should be printed. Defaults to 1.

@luau/global/error.documentation: Halts thread execution and throws an error.

@luau/global/getfenv/param/0.documentation: The stack level (int) of the environment to be returned; or the function whose environment will be returned.

@luau/global/getfenv.documentation: Returns the current environment in use by the caller, as a dictionary.

@luau/global/getmetatable/param/0.documentation: The object to fetch the metatable of.

@luau/global/getmetatable.documentation: Returns the metatable of the given table.

@luau/global/ipairs/param/0.documentation: A table whose elements are to be iterated over.

@luau/global/ipairs.documentation: Returns an iterator function and the table for use in a for loop.

@luau/global/loadstring/param/0.documentation: The specified string to be loaded as Lua code.

@luau/global/loadstring/param/1.documentation: An optional chunk name for error messages and debug information. If unspecified, Lua uses the contents string.

@luau/global/loadstring.documentation: Returns the provided code as a function that can be executed.

@luau/global/newproxy.documentation: Creates a blank userdata, with the option for it to have a metatable.

@luau/global/next/param/1.documentation: The last key that was previously retrieved from a call to next.

@luau/global/next.documentation: An iterator function for use in for loops.

@luau/global/pairs/param/0.documentation: An array or dictionary table to iterate over.

@luau/global/pairs.documentation: Returns an iterator function and the provided table for use in a for loop.

@luau/global/pcall/param/0.documentation: The function to be called in protected mode.

@luau/global/pcall/param/1.documentation: The arguments to send to func when executing.

@luau/global/pcall.documentation: Runs the provided function and catches any error it throws, returning the function's success and its results.

@luau/global/print/param/0.documentation: Any number of arguments to be outputted.

@luau/global/print.documentation: Prints all provided values to the output.

@luau/global/rawequal.documentation: Returns whether v1 is equal to v2, bypassing their metamethods.

@luau/global/rawget.documentation: Gets the real value of table[index], bypassing any metamethods.

@luau/global/rawlen.documentation: Returns the length of the string or table, bypassing any metamethods.

@luau/global/rawset/param/1.documentation: The index to set in t to a specified value. Must be different from nil.

@luau/global/rawset/param/2.documentation: The value to be set to a specified index in table t.

@luau/global/rawset.documentation: Sets the real value of table[index], bypassing any metamethods.

@luau/global/select/param/0.documentation: The index of the argument to return all arguments after in args. or must be "#".

@luau/global/select.documentation: Returns all arguments after the given index.

@luau/global/setfenv/param/0.documentation: Either a function or a number that specifies the function at that stack level.

@luau/global/setfenv/param/1.documentation: The function environment table to set for the specified function.

@luau/global/setmetatable/param/0.documentation: The table to set the metatable of.

@luau/global/setmetatable/param/1.documentation: If nil, the metatable of the given table t is removed. Otherwise, the metatable to set for the given table t.

@luau/global/tonumber/param/0.documentation: The object to be converted into a number.

@luau/global/tonumber/param/1.documentation: The numerical base to convert arg into.

@luau/global/tonumber.documentation: Returns the provided value converted to a number, or nil if impossible.

@luau/global/tostring/param/0.documentation: The object to be converted into a string.

@luau/global/tostring.documentation: Returns the provided value converted to a string, or nil if impossible.

@luau/global/type/param/0.documentation: The object to return the type of.

@luau/global/type.documentation: Returns the basic type of the provided object.

@luau/global/unpack/param/0.documentation: The list of elements to be unpacked.

@luau/global/unpack/param/1.documentation: The index of the first element to unpack.

@luau/global/unpack/param/2.documentation: The index of the last element to unpack.

@luau/global/unpack.documentation: Returns all elements from the given list as a tuple.

@luau/global/xpcall/param/0.documentation: The function to be called in protected mode.

@luau/global/xpcall/param/1.documentation: The function to be used as an error handle if xpcall catches an error.

@luau/global/xpcall.documentation: Similar to pcall() except it uses a custom error handler.

@roblox/global/delay/param/0.documentation: The amount of time that this function will be queued before being executed.

@roblox/global/delay/param/1.documentation: The function that will be executed once delayTime seconds have passed.

@roblox/global/delay.documentation: Schedules a function to be called on the next Heartbeat after the given duration (in seconds) has passed, with throttling.

@roblox/global/DebuggerManager.documentation: Refers to the DebuggerManager, which acts as an interface for the Lua debugger feature.

@roblox/global/elapsedTime.documentation: Returns the amount of time in seconds that the current instance of Roblox has been running for.

@roblox/global/gcinfo.documentation: Returns the total memory heap size in kilobytes.

@roblox/global/PluginManager.documentation: Refers to the PluginManager, a deprecated singleton that was previously required to create plugins.

@roblox/global/printidentity.documentation: Prints "Current identity is X", where X corresponds to the current thread's security context level.

@roblox/global/require/param/0.documentation: The ModuleScript that will be executed to retrieve the return value it provides.

@roblox/global/require/return/0.documentation: What the ModuleScript returned (usually a table or a function).

@roblox/global/require.documentation: Returns the value that was returned by the given ModuleScript, running it if it has not been run yet.

@roblox/global/settings.documentation: Returns the GlobalSettings object, which can be used to access settings objects that configure Roblox Studio's behavior.

@roblox/global/spawn/param/0.documentation: The function that will be executed.

@roblox/global/spawn.documentation: Calls a function immediately through the engine scheduler, with throttling.

@roblox/global/tick.documentation: Returns the amount of time in seconds since the Unix epoch according to this device's time.

@roblox/global/time.documentation: Returns the amount of time in seconds that has elapsed since the current game instance started running.

@roblox/global/typeof/param/0.documentation: The Lua type that will have its type checked.

@roblox/global/typeof.documentation: Returns the type of the given object as a string, also supporting Roblox-specific types (e.g. Vector3).

@roblox/global/UserSettings.documentation: Returns the UserSettings object, which is used to read information from the current user's game menu settings.

@roblox/global/version.documentation: Returns the current version of Roblox as a string, which includes the generation, version, patch and commit.

@roblox/global/wait/param/0.documentation: Specifies how long the thread should yield for.

@roblox/global/wait.documentation: Yields the current thread until the specified amount of time in seconds have elapsed, with throttling.

@roblox/global/warn/param/0.documentation: This function accepts any number of arguments, and will attempt to convert them into strings which will then be joined together with spaces between them.

@roblox/global/warn.documentation: Behaves similarly to print, except with more distinct formatting (yellow); intended for messages which describe potential problems.
